get.summary: Retrieves information for one or more API keys
get.description: NOTE: If you have only the `manage_own_api_key` privilege, this API returns only the API keys that you own. If you have `read_security`, `manage_api_key` or greater privileges (including `manage_security`), this API returns all API keys regardless of ownership.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
An API key id.
This parameter cannot be used with any of `name`, `realm_name` or `username`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
An API key name.
This parameter cannot be used with any of `id`, `realm_name` or `username`.
It supports prefix search with wildcard.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description:
A boolean flag that can be used to query API keys owned by the currently authenticated user.
The `realm_name` or `username` parameters cannot be specified when this parameter is set to `true` as they are assumed to be the currently authenticated ones.

parameters.name: realm_name
parameters.description:
The name of an authentication realm.
This parameter cannot be used with either `id` or `name` or when `owner` flag is set to `true`.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description:
The username of a user.
This parameter cannot be used with either `id` or `name` or when `owner` flag is set to `true`.

parameters.name: with_limited_by
parameters.description:
Return the snapshot of the owner user's role descriptors
associated with the API key. An API key's actual
permission is the intersection of its assigned role
descriptors and the owner user's role descriptors.

parameters.name: active_only
parameters.description: A boolean flag that can be used to query API keys that are currently active. An API key is considered active if it is neither invalidated, nor expired at query time. You can specify this together with other parameters such as `owner` or `name`. If `active_only` is false, the response will include both active and inactive (expired or invalidated) keys.

parameters.name: with_profile_uid
parameters.description: Determines whether to also retrieve the profile uid, for the API key owner principal, if it exists.

put.summary: Creates an API key for access without requiring basic authentication
put.description: A successful request returns a JSON structure that contains the API key, its unique id, and its name. If applicable, it also returns expiration information for the API key in milliseconds. NOTE: By default, API keys never expire. You can specify expiration information when you create the API keys.

post.summary: Creates an API key for access without requiring basic authentication
post.description: A successful request returns a JSON structure that contains the API key, its unique id, and its name. If applicable, it also returns expiration information for the API key in milliseconds. NOTE: By default, API keys never expire. You can specify expiration information when you create the API keys.

delete.summary: Invalidates one or more API keys
delete.description: The `manage_api_key` privilege allows deleting any API keys. The `manage_own_api_key` only allows deleting API keys that are owned by the user. In addition, with the `manage_own_api_key` privilege, an invalidation request must be issued in one of the three formats: - Set the parameter `owner=true`. - Or, set both `username` and `realm_name` to match the user’s identity. - Or, if the request is issued by an API key, i.e. an API key invalidates itself, specify its ID in the `ids` field.

ids.description:
A list of API key ids.
This parameter cannot be used with any of `name`, `realm_name`, or `username`.

owner.description:

The `realm_name` or `username` parameters cannot be specified when this parameter is set to `true` as they are assumed to be the currently authenticated ones.

realm_name.description:

post.summary: Creates an API key on behalf of another user
post.description: This API is similar to Create API keys, however it creates the API key for a user that is different than the user that runs the API. The caller must have authentication credentials (either an access token, or a username and password) for the user on whose behalf the API key will be created. It is not possible to use this API to create an API key without that user’s credentials. The user, for whom the authentication credentials is provided, can optionally "run as" (impersonate) another user. In this case, the API key will be created on behalf of the impersonated user.. This API is intended be used by applications that need to create and manage API keys for end users, but cannot guarantee that those users have permission to create API keys on their own behalf.. A successful grant API key API call returns a JSON structure that contains the API key, its unique id, and its name. If applicable, it also returns expiration information for the API key in milliseconds.. By default, API keys never expire. You can specify expiration information when you create the API keys.

access_token.description:
The user’s access token.
If you specify the `access_token` grant type, this parameter is required.
It is not valid with other grant types.

post.summary: Verifies the logout response sent from the SAML IdP

query_string.description: If the SAML IdP sends the logout response with the HTTP-Redirect binding, this field must be set to the query string of the redirect URI.

content.description: If the SAML IdP sends the logout response with the HTTP-Post binding, this field must be set to the value of the SAMLResponse form parameter from the logout response.

post.summary: Submits a SAML LogoutRequest message to Elasticsearch for consumption

acs.description: The Assertion Consumer Service URL that matches the one of the SAML realm in Elasticsearch that should be used. You must specify either this parameter or the realm parameter.

query_string.description:
The query part of the URL that the user was redirected to by the SAML IdP to initiate the Single Logout.
This query should include a single parameter named SAMLRequest that contains a SAML logout request that is deflated and Base64 encoded.
If the SAML IdP has signed the logout request, the URL should include two extra parameters named SigAlg and Signature that contain the algorithm used for the signature and the signature value itself.
In order for Elasticsearch to be able to verify the IdP’s signature, the value of the query_string field must be an exact match to the string provided by the browser.
The client application must not attempt to parse or process the string in any way.

realm.description: The name of the SAML realm in Elasticsearch the configuration. You must specify either this parameter or the acs parameter.

refresh_token.description:
The refresh token that was returned as a response to calling the SAML authenticate API.
Alternatively, the most recent refresh token that was received after refreshing the original access token.

put.summary: Updates attributes of an existing API key
put.description: Users can only update API keys that they created or that were granted to them. Use this API to update API keys created by the create API Key or grant API Key APIs. If you need to apply the same update to many API keys, you can use bulk update API Keys to reduce overhead. It’s not possible to update expired API keys, or API keys that have been invalidated by invalidate API Key. This API supports updates to an API key’s access scope and metadata. The access scope of an API key is derived from the `role_descriptors` you specify in the request, and a snapshot of the owner user’s permissions at the time of the request. The snapshot of the owner’s permissions is updated automatically on every call. If you don’t specify `role_descriptors` in the request, a call to this API might still change the API key’s access scope. This change can occur if the owner user’s permissions have changed since the API key was created or last modified. To update another user’s API key, use the `run_as` feature to submit a request on behalf of another user. IMPORTANT: It’s not possible to use an API key as the authentication credential for this API. To update an API key, the owner user’s credentials are required.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the API key to update.

role_descriptors.description: An array of role descriptors for this API key. This parameter is optional. When it is not specified or is an empty array, then the API key will have a point in time snapshot of permissions of the authenticated user. If you supply role descriptors then the resultant permissions would be an intersection of API keys permissions and authenticated user’s permissions thereby limiting the access scope for API keys. The structure of role descriptor is the same as the request for create role API. For more details, see create or update roles API.

updated.description:
If `true`, the API key was updated.
If `false`, the API key didn’t change because no change was detected.

get.summary: Retrieve status of a node or nodes that are currently marked as shutting down
get.description: Designed for indirect use by ECE/ESS and ECK. Direct use is not supported.

put.summary: Adds a node to be shut down
put.description: Designed for indirect use by ECE/ESS and ECK. Direct use is not supported.

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: The node id of node to be shut down

parameters.name: master_timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

reason.description:
A human-readable reason that the node is being shut down.
This field provides information for other cluster operators; it does not affect the shut down process.

allocation_delay.description:
Only valid if type is restart.
Controls how long Elasticsearch will wait for the node to restart and join the cluster before reassigning its shards to other nodes.
This works the same as delaying allocation with the index.unassigned.node_left.delayed_timeout setting.
If you specify both a restart allocation delay and an index-level allocation delay, the longer of the two is used.

target_node_name.description:
Only valid if type is replace.
Specifies the name of the node that is replacing the node being shut down.
Shards from the shut down node are only allowed to be allocated to the target node, and no other data will be allocated to the target node.
During relocation of data certain allocation rules are ignored, such as disk watermarks or user attribute filtering rules.

get.summary: Returns information about a snapshot

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of snapshot repository names used to limit the request. Wildcard (*) expressions are supported.

parameters.name: snapshot
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of snapshot names to retrieve. Also accepts wildcards (*).
- To get information about all snapshots in a registered repository, use a wildcard (*) or _all.
- To get information about any snapshots that are currently running, use _current.

parameters.name: ignore_unavailable
parameters.description: If false, the request returns an error for any snapshots that are unavailable.

parameters.name: master_timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: If true, returns additional information about each snapshot such as the version of Elasticsearch which took the snapshot, the start and end times of the snapshot, and the number of shards snapshotted.

parameters.name: index_details
parameters.description: If true, returns additional information about each index in the snapshot comprising the number of shards in the index, the total size of the index in bytes, and the maximum number of segments per shard in the index. Defaults to false, meaning that this information is omitted.

parameters.name: index_names
parameters.description: If true, returns the name of each index in each snapshot.

parameters.name: include_repository
parameters.description: If true, returns the repository name in each snapshot.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Allows setting a sort order for the result. Defaults to start_time, i.e. sorting by snapshot start time stamp.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of snapshots to return. Defaults to 0 which means return all that match the request without limit.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order. Valid values are asc for ascending and desc for descending order. Defaults to asc, meaning ascending order.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Offset identifier to start pagination from as returned by the next field in the response body.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Numeric offset to start pagination from based on the snapshots matching this request. Using a non-zero value for this parameter is mutually exclusive with using the after parameter. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: from_sort_value
parameters.description: Value of the current sort column at which to start retrieval. Can either be a string snapshot- or repository name when sorting by snapshot or repository name, a millisecond time value or a number when sorting by index- or shard count.

parameters.name: slm_policy_filter
parameters.description: Filter snapshots by a comma-separated list of SLM policy names that snapshots belong to. Also accepts wildcards (*) and combinations of wildcards followed by exclude patterns starting with -. To include snapshots not created by an SLM policy you can use the special pattern _none that will match all snapshots without an SLM policy.

total.description: The total number of snapshots that match the request when ignoring size limit or after query parameter.

remaining.description: The number of remaining snapshots that were not returned due to size limits and that can be fetched by additional requests using the next field value.

get.summary: Returns the current status and available results for an async SQL search or stored synchronous SQL search

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier for the search.

parameters.name: delimiter
parameters.description: Separator for CSV results. The API only supports this parameter for CSV responses.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
Format for the response. You must specify a format using this parameter or the
Accept HTTP header. If you specify both, the API uses this parameter.

parameters.name: keep_alive
parameters.description:
Retention period for the search and its results. Defaults
to the `keep_alive` period for the original SQL search.

parameters.name: wait_for_completion_timeout
parameters.description:
Period to wait for complete results. Defaults to no timeout,
meaning the request waits for complete search results.

is_running.description:
If `true`, the search is still running. If false, the search has finished.
This value is only returned for async and saved synchronous searches. For
CSV, TSV, and TXT responses, this value is returned in the `Async-partial`
HTTP header.

is_partial.description:
If `true`, the response does not contain complete search results. If `is_partial`
is `true` and `is_running` is `true`, the search is still running. If `is_partial`
is `true` but `is_running` is `false`, the results are partial due to a failure or
timeout. This value is only returned for async and saved synchronous searches.
For CSV, TSV, and TXT responses, this value is returned in the `Async-partial` HTTP header.

columns.description: Column headings for the search results. Each object is a column.

cursor.description:
Cursor for the next set of paginated results. For CSV, TSV, and
TXT responses, this value is returned in the `Cursor` HTTP header.

parameters.name: id

is_partial.description:

is `true` and `is_running` is `true`, the search is still running. If `is_partial`
is `true` but `is_running` is `false`, the results are partial due to a failure or
timeout.

Finds the structure of a text file
post.description: The text file must contain data that is suitable to be ingested into Elasticsearch.

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: The text’s character set. It must be a character set that is supported by the JVM that Elasticsearch uses. For example, UTF-8, UTF-16LE, windows-1252, or EUC-JP. If this parameter is not specified, the structure finder chooses an appropriate character set.

parameters.name: column_names
parameters.description: If you have set format to delimited, you can specify the column names in a comma-separated list. If this parameter is not specified, the structure finder uses the column names from the header row of the text. If the text does not have a header role, columns are named "column1", "column2", "column3", etc.

parameters.name: delimiter
parameters.description: If you have set format to delimited, you can specify the character used to delimit the values in each row. Only a single character is supported; the delimiter cannot have multiple characters. By default, the API considers the following possibilities: comma, tab, semi-colon, and pipe (|). In this default scenario, all rows must have the same number of fields for the delimited format to be detected. If you specify a delimiter, up to 10% of the rows can have a different number of columns than the first row.

parameters.name: ecs_compatibility
parameters.description: The mode of compatibility with ECS compliant Grok patterns (disabled or v1, default: disabled).

parameters.name: explain
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to true, the response includes a field named explanation, which is an array of strings that indicate how the structure finder produced its result.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The high level structure of the text. Valid values are ndjson, xml, delimited, and semi_structured_text. By default, the API chooses the format. In this default scenario, all rows must have the same number of fields for a delimited format to be detected. If the format is set to delimited and the delimiter is not set, however, the API tolerates up to 5% of rows that have a different number of columns than the first row.

parameters.name: grok_pattern
parameters.description: If you have set format to semi_structured_text, you can specify a Grok pattern that is used to extract fields from every message in the text. The name of the timestamp field in the Grok pattern must match what is specified in the timestamp_field parameter. If that parameter is not specified, the name of the timestamp field in the Grok pattern must match "timestamp". If grok_pattern is not specified, the structure finder creates a Grok pattern.

parameters.name: has_header_row
parameters.description: If you have set format to delimited, you can use this parameter to indicate whether the column names are in the first row of the text. If this parameter is not specified, the structure finder guesses based on the similarity of the first row of the text to other rows.

parameters.name: line_merge_size_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of characters in a message when lines are merged to form messages while analyzing semi-structured text. If you have extremely long messages you may need to increase this, but be aware that this may lead to very long processing times if the way to group lines into messages is misdetected.

parameters.name: lines_to_sample
parameters.description: The number of lines to include in the structural analysis, starting from the beginning of the text. The minimum is 2; If the value of this parameter is greater than the number of lines in the text, the analysis proceeds (as long as there are at least two lines in the text) for all of the lines.

parameters.name: quote
parameters.description: If you have set format to delimited, you can specify the character used to quote the values in each row if they contain newlines or the delimiter character. Only a single character is supported. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is a double quote ("). If your delimited text format does not use quoting, a workaround is to set this argument to a character that does not appear anywhere in the sample.

parameters.name: should_trim_fields
parameters.description: If you have set format to delimited, you can specify whether values between delimiters should have whitespace trimmed from them. If this parameter is not specified and the delimiter is pipe (|), the default value is true. Otherwise, the default value is false.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Sets the maximum amount of time that the structure analysis make take. If the analysis is still running when the timeout expires then it will be aborted.

parameters.name: timestamp_field
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify the timestamp field in the file

parameters.name: timestamp_format
parameters.description: The Java time format of the timestamp field in the text.

get.summary: Retrieves configuration information for transforms

put.summary: Creates a transform.
put.description: A transform copies data from source indices, transforms it, and persists it into an entity-centric destination index. You can also think of the destination index as a two-dimensional tabular data structure (known as a data frame). The ID for each document in the data frame is generated from a hash of the entity, so there is a unique row per entity.. You must choose either the latest or pivot method for your transform; you cannot use both in a single transform. If you choose to use the pivot method for your transform, the entities are defined by the set of `group_by` fields in the pivot object. If you choose to use the latest method, the entities are defined by the `unique_key` field values in the latest object.. You must have `create_index`, `index`, and `read` privileges on the destination index and `read` and `view_index_metadata` privileges on the source indices. When Elasticsearch security features are enabled, the transform remembers which roles the user that created it had at the time of creation and uses those same roles. If those roles do not have the required privileges on the source and destination indices, the transform fails when it attempts unauthorized operations.. NOTE: You must use Kibana or this API to create a transform. Do not add a transform directly into any `.transform-internal*` indices using the Elasticsearch index API. If Elasticsearch security features are enabled, do not give users any privileges on `.transform-internal*` indices. If you used transforms prior to 7.5, also do not give users any privileges on `.data-frame-internal*` indices.

parameters.name: transform_id
parameters.description:
Identifier for the transform. This identifier can contain lowercase alphanumeric characters (a-z and 0-9),
hyphens, and underscores. It has a 64 character limit and must start and end with alphanumeric characters.

parameters.name: defer_validation
parameters.description:
When the transform is created, a series of validations occur to ensure its success. For example, there is a
check for the existence of the source indices and a check that the destination index is not part of the source
index pattern. You can use this parameter to skip the checks, for example when the source index does not exist
until after the transform is created. The validations are always run when you start the transform, however, with
the exception of privilege checks.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

description.description: Free text description of the transform.

delete.summary: Deletes a transform

parameters.name: transform_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the transform.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description:
If this value is false, the transform must be stopped before it can be deleted. If true, the transform is
deleted regardless of its current state.

parameters.name: delete_dest_index
parameters.description:
If this value is true, the destination index is deleted together with the transform. If false, the destination
index will not be deleted

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

get.summary: Retrieves configuration information for transforms
Retrieves usage information for transforms

parameters.name: transform_id
parameters.description:
Identifier for the transform. It can be a transform identifier or a
wildcard expression. You can get information for all transforms by using
`_all`, by specifying `*` as the `<transform_id>`, or by omitting the
`<transform_id>`.

parameters.name: allow_no_match
parameters.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no transforms that match.
2. Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If this parameter is false, the request returns a 404 status code when
there are no matches or only partial matches.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Skips the specified number of transforms.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of transforms to obtain.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Controls the time to wait for the stats

get.summary: Previews a transform.
get.description: It returns a maximum of 100 results. The calculations are based on all the current data in the source index. It also generates a list of mappings and settings for the destination index. These values are determined based on the field types of the source index and the transform aggregations.

post.summary: Previews a transform.
post.description: It returns a maximum of 100 results. The calculations are based on all the current data in the source index. It also generates a list of mappings and settings for the destination index. These values are determined based on the field types of the source index and the transform aggregations.

get.summary: Previews a transform.
get.description: It returns a maximum of 100 results. The calculations are based on all the current data in the source index. It also generates a list of mappings and settings for the destination index. These values are determined based on the field types of the source index and the transform aggregations.

post.summary: Previews a transform.
post.description: It returns a maximum of 100 results. The calculations are based on all the current data in the source index. It also generates a list of mappings and settings for the destination index. These values are determined based on the field types of the source index and the transform aggregations.

post.summary: Resets a transform
post.description: Before you can reset it, you must stop it; alternatively, use the `force` query parameter. If the destination index was created by the transform, it is deleted.

parameters.name: transform_id
parameters.description:
Identifier for the transform. This identifier can contain lowercase alphanumeric characters (a-z and 0-9),
hyphens, and underscores. It has a 64 character limit and must start and end with alphanumeric characters.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description:
If this value is `true`, the transform is reset regardless of its current state. If it's `false`, the transform
must be stopped before it can be reset.

post.summary: Schedules now a transform.
post.description: If you _schedule_now a transform, it will process the new data instantly, without waiting for the configured frequency interval. After _schedule_now API is called, the transform will be processed again at now + frequency unless _schedule_now API is called again in the meantime.

parameters.name: transform_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the transform.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Controls the time to wait for the scheduling to take place

post.summary: Starts a transform.
post.description: When you start a transform, it creates the destination index if it does not already exist. The `number_of_shards` is set to `1` and the `auto_expand_replicas` is set to `0-1`. If it is a pivot transform, it deduces the mapping definitions for the destination index from the source indices and the transform aggregations. If fields in the destination index are derived from scripts (as in the case of `scripted_metric` or `bucket_script` aggregations), the transform uses dynamic mappings unless an index template exists. If it is a latest transform, it does not deduce mapping definitions; it uses dynamic mappings. To use explicit mappings, create the destination index before you start the transform. Alternatively, you can create an index template, though it does not affect the deduced mappings in a pivot transform.. When the transform starts, a series of validations occur to ensure its success. If you deferred validation when you created the transform, they occur when you start the transform—​with the exception of privilege checks. When Elasticsearch security features are enabled, the transform remembers which roles the user that created it had at the time of creation and uses those same roles. If those roles do not have the required privileges on the source and destination indices, the transform fails when it attempts unauthorized operations.

parameters.name: transform_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the transform.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Restricts the set of transformed entities to those changed after this time. Relative times like now-30d are supported. Only applicable for continuous transforms.

post.summary: Stops one or more transforms

parameters.name: transform_id
parameters.description:
Identifier for the transform. To stop multiple transforms, use a comma-separated list or a wildcard expression.
To stop all transforms, use `_all` or `*` as the identifier.

parameters.name: allow_no_match
parameters.description:
Specifies what to do when the request: contains wildcard expressions and there are no transforms that match;
contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches; contains wildcard expressions and there
are only partial matches.

If it is true, the API returns a successful acknowledgement message when there are no matches. When there are
only partial matches, the API stops the appropriate transforms.

If it is false, the request returns a 404 status code when there are no matches or only partial matches.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If it is true, the API forcefully stops the transforms.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Period to wait for a response when `wait_for_completion` is `true`. If no response is received before the
timeout expires, the request returns a timeout exception. However, the request continues processing and
eventually moves the transform to a STOPPED state.

parameters.name: wait_for_checkpoint
parameters.description:
If it is true, the transform does not completely stop until the current checkpoint is completed. If it is false,
the transform stops as soon as possible.

parameters.name: wait_for_completion
parameters.description:
If it is true, the API blocks until the indexer state completely stops. If it is false, the API returns
immediately and the indexer is stopped asynchronously in the background.

post.summary: Updates certain properties of a transform.
post.description: All updated properties except `description` do not take effect until after the transform starts the next checkpoint, thus there is data consistency in each checkpoint. To use this API, you must have `read` and `view_index_metadata` privileges for the source indices. You must also have `index` and `read` privileges for the destination index. When Elasticsearch security features are enabled, the transform remembers which roles the user who updated it had at the time of update and runs with those privileges.

parameters.name: transform_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the transform.

parameters.name: defer_validation
parameters.description:
When true, deferrable validations are not run. This behavior may be
desired if the source index does not exist until after the transform is
created.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the
timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

description.description: Free text description of the transform.

retention_policy.description:
Defines a retention policy for the transform. Data that meets the defined
criteria is deleted from the destination index.

post.summary: Upgrades all transforms
post.description: This API identifies transforms that have a legacy configuration format and upgrades them to the latest version. It also cleans up the internal data structures that store the transform state and checkpoints. The upgrade does not affect the source and destination indices. The upgrade also does not affect the roles that transforms use when Elasticsearch security features are enabled; the role used to read source data and write to the destination index remains unchanged.

parameters.name: dry_run
parameters.description: When true, the request checks for updates but does not run them.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and
returns an error.

needs_update.description: The number of transforms that need to be upgraded.

no_action.description: The number of transforms that don’t require upgrading.

updated.description: The number of transforms that have been upgraded.

post.summary: Updates a document with a script or partial document

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The name of the index

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Document ID

parameters.name: if_primary_term
parameters.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this primary term.

parameters.name: if_seq_no
parameters.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this sequence number.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The script language.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description:
If 'true', Elasticsearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation
visible to search, if 'wait_for' then wait for a refresh to make this operation
visible to search, if 'false' do nothing with refreshes.

parameters.name: require_alias
parameters.description: If true, the destination must be an index alias.

parameters.name: retry_on_conflict
parameters.description: Specify how many times should the operation be retried when a conflict occurs.

parameters.name: routing
parameters.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Period to wait for dynamic mapping updates and active shards.
This guarantees Elasticsearch waits for at least the timeout before failing.
The actual wait time could be longer, particularly when multiple waits occur.

parameters.name: wait_for_active_shards
parameters.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operations.
Set to 'all' or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index
(number_of_replicas+1). Defaults to 1 meaning the primary shard.

parameters.name: _source
parameters.description:
Set to false to disable source retrieval. You can also specify a comma-separated
list of the fields you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: _source_excludes
parameters.description: Specify the source fields you want to exclude.

parameters.name: _source_includes
parameters.description: Specify the source fields you want to retrieve.

detect_noop.description:
Set to false to disable setting 'result' in the response
to 'noop' if no change to the document occurred.

doc.description: A partial update to an existing document.

doc_as_upsert.description: Set to true to use the contents of 'doc' as the value of 'upsert'

scripted_upsert.description: Set to true to execute the script whether or not the document exists.

upsert.description:
If the document does not already exist, the contents of 'upsert' are inserted as a
new document. If the document exists, the 'script' is executed.

post.summary: Updates documents that match the specified query
post.description: If no query is specified, performs an update on every document in the data stream or index without modifying the source, which is useful for picking up mapping changes.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams or indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

parameters.name: allow_no_indices
parameters.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

parameters.name: analyzer
parameters.description: Analyzer to use for the query string.

parameters.name: analyze_wildcard
parameters.description: If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.

parameters.name: conflicts
parameters.description: What to do if update by query hits version conflicts: `abort` or `proceed`.

parameters.name: default_operator
parameters.description: The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.

parameters.name: expand_wildcards
parameters.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Starting offset (default: 0)

parameters.name: ignore_unavailable
parameters.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

parameters.name: lenient
parameters.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

parameters.name: max_docs
parameters.description:
Maximum number of documents to process.
Defaults to all documents.

parameters.name: pipeline
parameters.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

parameters.name: preference
parameters.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description: If `true`, Elasticsearch refreshes affected shards to make the operation visible to search.

parameters.name: request_cache
parameters.description: If `true`, the request cache is used for this request.

parameters.name: requests_per_second
parameters.description: The throttle for this request in sub-requests per second.

parameters.name: routing
parameters.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

parameters.name: scroll
parameters.description: Period to retain the search context for scrolling.

parameters.name: scroll_size
parameters.description: Size of the scroll request that powers the operation.

parameters.name: search_timeout
parameters.description: Explicit timeout for each search request.

parameters.name: search_type
parameters.description: The type of the search operation. Available options: `query_then_fetch`, `dfs_query_then_fetch`.

parameters.name: slices
parameters.description: The number of slices this task should be divided into.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of <field>:<direction> pairs.

parameters.name: stats
parameters.description: Specific `tag` of the request for logging and statistical purposes.

parameters.name: terminate_after
parameters.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early.
Elasticsearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Elasticsearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Elasticsearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Period each update request waits for the following operations: dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

parameters.name: version_type
parameters.description: Should the document increment the version number (internal) on hit or not (reindex)

parameters.name: wait_for_active_shards
parameters.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

parameters.name: wait_for_completion
parameters.description: If `true`, the request blocks until the operation is complete.

max_docs.description: The maximum number of documents to update.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ID for the task.

parameters.name: requests_per_second
parameters.description: The throttle for this request in sub-requests per second.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the information categories to include in the response. For example, `build,license,features`.

parameters.name: accept_enterprise
parameters.description: If this param is used it must be set to true

parameters.name: human
parameters.description: Defines whether additional human-readable information is included in the response. In particular, it adds descriptions and a tag line.

get.summary: This API provides information about which features are currently enabled and available under the current license and some usage statistics

parameters.name: master_timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

backing_indices.description: Total number of backing indices for the selected data streams.

data_stream_count.description: Total number of selected data streams.

data_streams.description: Contains statistics for the selected data streams.

total_store_size_bytes.description: Total size, in bytes, of all shards for the selected data streams.

took.description: Milliseconds it took Elasticsearch to execute the request.

timed_out.description:
If true, the request timed out before completion;
returned results may be partial or empty.

fields.description:
Contains field values for the documents. These fields
must be specified in the request using the `fields` parameter.

max_score.description:
Highest returned document score. This value is null for requests
that do not sort by score.

field_selection.description: An array of objects that explain selection for each field, sorted by the field names.

data_frame_analytics.description: An array of data frame analytics job resources, which are sorted by the id value in ascending order.
An array of objects that contain usage information for data frame analytics jobs, which are sorted by the id value in ascending order.

trained_model_configs.description: An array of trained model resources, which are sorted by the model_id value in ascending order.

count.description: The total number of trained model statistics that matched the requested ID patterns. Could be higher than the number of items in the trained_model_stats array as the size of the array is restricted by the supplied size parameter.

trained_model_stats.description: An array of trained model statistics, which are sorted by the model_id value in ascending order.

feature_values.description: An array of objects that contain feature name and value pairs. The features have been processed and indicate what will be sent to the model for training.

errors.description: True if there is was an error

metric_score.description: The overall evaluation quality calculated by the defined metric

details.description: The details section contains one entry for every query in the original requests section, keyed by the search request id

expiration.description: Expiration in milliseconds for the API key.

encoded.description:
API key credentials which is the base64-encoding of
the UTF-8 representation of `id` and `api_key` joined
by a colon (`:`).

has_privilege_uids.description:
The subset of the requested profile IDs of the users that
have all the requested privileges.

total.description: The total number of API keys found.

count.description: The number of API keys returned in the response.

api_keys.description: A list of API key information.

accepted.description: Equals `true` if the snapshot was accepted. Present when the request had `wait_for_completion` set to `false`

is_running.description:
If `true`, the search is still running. If false, the search has finished.
This value is only returned for async and saved synchronous searches. For
CSV, TSV, and TXT responses, this value is returned in the `Async-partial`
HTTP header.

is_partial.description:
If `true`, the response does not contain complete search results. If `is_partial`
is `true` and `is_running` is `true`, the search is still running. If `is_partial`
is `true` but `is_running` is `false`, the results are partial due to a failure or
timeout. This value is only returned for async and saved synchronous searches.
For CSV, TSV, and TXT responses, this value is returned in the `Async-partial` HTTP header.

columns.description: Column headings for the search results. Each object is a column.

cursor.description:
Cursor for the next set of paginated results. For CSV, TSV, and
TXT responses, this value is returned in the `Cursor` HTTP header.

async_search.submit#index.name: index
async_search.submit#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names to search; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

async_search.submit#wait_for_completion_.name: wait_for_completion_timeout
async_search.submit#wait_for_completion_.description:
Blocks and waits until the search is completed up to a certain timeout.
When the async search completes within the timeout, the response won’t include the ID as the results are not stored in the cluster.

async_search.submit#keep_on_completion.name: keep_on_completion
async_search.submit#keep_on_completion.description: If `true`, results are stored for later retrieval when the search completes within the `wait_for_completion_timeout`.

async_search.submit#keep_alive.name: keep_alive
async_search.submit#keep_alive.description:
Specifies how long the async search needs to be available.
Ongoing async searches and any saved search results are deleted after this period.

async_search.submit#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
async_search.submit#allow_no_indices.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

async_search.submit#allow_partial_search.name: allow_partial_search_results
async_search.submit#allow_partial_search.description: Indicate if an error should be returned if there is a partial search failure or timeout

async_search.submit#analyzer.name: analyzer
async_search.submit#analyzer.description: The analyzer to use for the query string

async_search.submit#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
async_search.submit#analyze_wildcard.description: Specify whether wildcard and prefix queries should be analyzed (default: false)

async_search.submit#batched_reduce_size.name: batched_reduce_size
async_search.submit#batched_reduce_size.description:
Affects how often partial results become available, which happens whenever shard results are reduced.
A partial reduction is performed every time the coordinating node has received a certain number of new shard responses (5 by default).

async_search.submit#ccs_minimize_roundtr.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
async_search.submit#ccs_minimize_roundtr.description: The default value is the only supported value.

async_search.submit#default_operator.name: default_operator
async_search.submit#default_operator.description: The default operator for query string query (AND or OR)

async_search.submit#df.name: df
async_search.submit#df.description: The field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string

async_search.submit#docvalue_fields.name: docvalue_fields
async_search.submit#docvalue_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return as the docvalue representation of a field for each hit

async_search.submit#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
async_search.submit#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

async_search.submit#explain.name: explain
async_search.submit#explain.description: Specify whether to return detailed information about score computation as part of a hit

async_search.submit#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
async_search.submit#ignore_throttled.description: Whether specified concrete, expanded or aliased indices should be ignored when throttled

async_search.submit#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
async_search.submit#ignore_unavailable.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

async_search.submit#lenient.name: lenient
async_search.submit#lenient.description: Specify whether format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) should be ignored

async_search.submit#max_concurrent_shard.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
async_search.submit#max_concurrent_shard.description: The number of concurrent shard requests per node this search executes concurrently. This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests

async_search.submit#preference.name: preference
async_search.submit#preference.description: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

async_search.submit#pre_filter_shard_siz.name: pre_filter_shard_size
async_search.submit#pre_filter_shard_siz.description: The default value cannot be changed, which enforces the execution of a pre-filter roundtrip to retrieve statistics from each shard so that the ones that surely don’t hold any document matching the query get skipped.

async_search.submit#request_cache.name: request_cache
async_search.submit#request_cache.description: Specify if request cache should be used for this request or not, defaults to true

async_search.submit#routing.name: routing
async_search.submit#routing.description: A comma-separated list of specific routing values

async_search.submit#stats.name: stats
async_search.submit#stats.description: Specific 'tag' of the request for logging and statistical purposes

async_search.submit#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
async_search.submit#stored_fields.description: A comma-separated list of stored fields to return as part of a hit

async_search.submit#suggest_field.name: suggest_field
async_search.submit#suggest_field.description: Specifies which field to use for suggestions.

async_search.submit#suggest_size.name: suggest_size
async_search.submit#suggest_size.description: How many suggestions to return in response

async_search.submit#suggest_text.name: suggest_text
async_search.submit#suggest_text.description: The source text for which the suggestions should be returned.

async_search.submit#terminate_after.name: terminate_after
async_search.submit#terminate_after.description: The maximum number of documents to collect for each shard, upon reaching which the query execution will terminate early.

async_search.submit#track_total_hits.name: track_total_hits
async_search.submit#track_total_hits.description: Indicate if the number of documents that match the query should be tracked. A number can also be specified, to accurately track the total hit count up to the number.

async_search.submit#track_scores.name: track_scores
async_search.submit#track_scores.description: Whether to calculate and return scores even if they are not used for sorting

async_search.submit#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
async_search.submit#typed_keys.description: Specify whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response

async_search.submit#version.name: version
async_search.submit#version.description: Specify whether to return document version as part of a hit

async_search.submit#_source.name: _source
async_search.submit#_source.description: True or false to return the _source field or not, or a list of fields to return

async_search.submit#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
async_search.submit#_source_excludes.description: A list of fields to exclude from the returned _source field

async_search.submit#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
async_search.submit#_source_includes.description: A list of fields to extract and return from the _source field

async_search.submit#seq_no_primary_term.name: seq_no_primary_term
async_search.submit#seq_no_primary_term.description: Specify whether to return sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit

async_search.submit#q.name: q
async_search.submit#q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax

bulk#index.name: index
bulk#index.description: Name of the data stream, index, or index alias to perform bulk actions on.

bulk#pipeline.name: pipeline
bulk#pipeline.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

bulk#refresh.name: refresh
bulk#refresh.description:
If `true`, Elasticsearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` do nothing with refreshes.
Valid values: `true`, `false`, `wait_for`.

bulk#routing.name: routing
bulk#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

bulk#_source.name: _source
bulk#_source.description: `true` or `false` to return the `_source` field or not, or a list of fields to return.

bulk#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
bulk#_source_excludes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.

bulk#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
bulk#_source_includes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.

bulk#timeout.name: timeout
bulk#timeout.description: Period each action waits for the following operations: automatic index creation, dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

bulk#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
bulk#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to all or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

bulk#require_alias.name: require_alias
bulk#require_alias.description: If `true`, the request’s actions must target an index alias.

cat.aliases#name.name: name
cat.aliases#name.description: A comma-separated list of aliases to retrieve. Supports wildcards (`*`).  To retrieve all aliases, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.aliases#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
cat.aliases#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

cat.allocation#node_id.name: node_id
cat.allocation#node_id.description: Comma-separated list of node identifiers or names used to limit the returned information.

cat.allocation#bytes.name: bytes
cat.allocation#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.component_templates#name.name: name
cat.component_templates#name.description: The name of the component template. Accepts wildcard expressions. If omitted, all component templates are returned.

cat.count#index.name: index
cat.count#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.fielddata#fields.name: fields
cat.fielddata#fields.description:
Comma-separated list of fields used to limit returned information.
To retrieve all fields, omit this parameter.

cat.fielddata#bytes.name: bytes
cat.fielddata#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.fielddata#fields_.name: fields
cat.fielddata#fields_.description: Comma-separated list of fields used to limit returned information.

cat.indices#index.name: index
cat.indices#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.indices#bytes.name: bytes
cat.indices#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.indices#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
cat.indices#expand_wildcards.description: The type of index that wildcard patterns can match.

cat.indices#health.name: health
cat.indices#health.description: The health status used to limit returned indices. By default, the response includes indices of any health status.

cat.indices#include_unloaded_segments.name: include_unloaded_segments
cat.indices#include_unloaded_segments.description: If true, the response includes information from segments that are not loaded into memory.

cat.indices#pri.name: pri
cat.indices#pri.description: If true, the response only includes information from primary shards.

cat.indices#time.name: time
cat.indices#time.description: The unit used to display time values.

cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#id.name: id
cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#id.description: The ID of the data frame analytics to fetch

cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#allow_no_mat.name: allow_no_match
cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#allow_no_mat.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard expression matches no configs. (This includes `_all` string or when no configs have been specified)

cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#bytes.name: bytes
cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#bytes.description: The unit in which to display byte values

cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#h.name: h
cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#h.description: Comma-separated list of column names to display.

cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#s.name: s

Comma-separated list of column names or column aliases used to sort the
response.

cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#time.name: time
cat.ml_data_frame_analytics#time.description: Unit used to display time values.

cat.ml_datafeeds#datafeed_id.name: datafeed_id
cat.ml_datafeeds#datafeed_id.description: A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the datafeed.

cat.ml_datafeeds#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
cat.ml_datafeeds#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

* Contains wildcard expressions and there are no datafeeds that match.
* Contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
* Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If `true`, the API returns an empty datafeeds array when there are no matches and the subset of results when
there are partial matches. If `false`, the API returns a 404 status code when there are no matches or only
partial matches.

cat.ml_datafeeds#h.name: h
cat.ml_datafeeds#h.description: Comma-separated list of column names to display.

cat.ml_datafeeds#s.name: s
cat.ml_datafeeds#s.description: Comma-separated list of column names or column aliases used to sort the response.

cat.ml_datafeeds#time.name: time
cat.ml_datafeeds#time.description: The unit used to display time values.

cat.ml_jobs#job_id.name: job_id
cat.ml_jobs#job_id.description: Identifier for the anomaly detection job.

cat.ml_jobs#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
cat.ml_jobs#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

* Contains wildcard expressions and there are no jobs that match.
* Contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
* Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If `true`, the API returns an empty jobs array when there are no matches and the subset of results when there
are partial matches. If `false`, the API returns a 404 status code when there are no matches or only partial
matches.

cat.ml_jobs#bytes.name: bytes
cat.ml_jobs#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.ml_jobs#h.name: h
cat.ml_jobs#h.description: Comma-separated list of column names to display.

cat.ml_jobs#s.name: s
cat.ml_jobs#s.description: Comma-separated list of column names or column aliases used to sort the response.

cat.ml_jobs#time.name: time
cat.ml_jobs#time.description: The unit used to display time values.

cat.ml_trained_models#model_id.name: model_id
cat.ml_trained_models#model_id.description: A unique identifier for the trained model.

cat.ml_trained_models#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
cat.ml_trained_models#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request: contains wildcard expressions and there are no models that match; contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches; contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.
If `true`, the API returns an empty array when there are no matches and the subset of results when there are partial matches.
If `false`, the API returns a 404 status code when there are no matches or only partial matches.

cat.ml_trained_models#bytes.name: bytes
cat.ml_trained_models#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.ml_trained_models#h.name: h
cat.ml_trained_models#h.description: A comma-separated list of column names to display.

cat.ml_trained_models#s.name: s
cat.ml_trained_models#s.description: A comma-separated list of column names or aliases used to sort the response.

cat.ml_trained_models#from.name: from
cat.ml_trained_models#from.description: Skips the specified number of transforms.

cat.ml_trained_models#size.name: size
cat.ml_trained_models#size.description: The maximum number of transforms to display.

cat.recovery#index.name: index
cat.recovery#index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.recovery#active_only.name: active_only
cat.recovery#active_only.description: If `true`, the response only includes ongoing shard recoveries.

cat.recovery#bytes.name: bytes
cat.recovery#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.recovery#detailed.name: detailed
cat.recovery#detailed.description: If `true`, the response includes detailed information about shard recoveries.

cat.segments#index.name: index
cat.segments#index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.segments#bytes.name: bytes
cat.segments#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.shards#index.name: index
cat.shards#index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.shards#bytes.name: bytes
cat.shards#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.snapshots#repository.name: repository
cat.snapshots#repository.description:
A comma-separated list of snapshot repositories used to limit the request.
Accepts wildcard expressions.
`_all` returns all repositories.
If any repository fails during the request, Elasticsearch returns an error.

cat.snapshots#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
cat.snapshots#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, the response does not include information from unavailable snapshots.

cat.templates#name.name: name
cat.templates#name.description:
The name of the template to return.
Accepts wildcard expressions. If omitted, all templates are returned.

cat.thread_pool#thread_pool_patterns.name: thread_pool_patterns
cat.thread_pool#thread_pool_patterns.description:
A comma-separated list of thread pool names used to limit the request.
Accepts wildcard expressions.

cat.thread_pool#time.name: time
cat.thread_pool#time.description: The unit used to display time values.

cat.transforms#transform_id.name: transform_id
cat.transforms#transform_id.description:
A transform identifier or a wildcard expression.
If you do not specify one of these options, the API returns information for all transforms.

cat.transforms#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
cat.transforms#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request: contains wildcard expressions and there are no transforms that match; contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches; contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.
If `true`, it returns an empty transforms array when there are no matches and the subset of results when there are partial matches.
If `false`, the request returns a 404 status code when there are no matches or only partial matches.

cat.transforms#from.name: from
cat.transforms#from.description: Skips the specified number of transforms.

cat.transforms#h.name: h
cat.transforms#h.description: Comma-separated list of column names to display.

cat.transforms#s.name: s
cat.transforms#s.description: Comma-separated list of column names or column aliases used to sort the response.

cat.transforms#time.name: time
cat.transforms#time.description: The unit used to display time values.

cat.transforms#size.name: size
cat.transforms#size.description: The maximum number of transforms to obtain.

ccr.get_auto_follow_pattern#name.name: name
ccr.get_auto_follow_pattern#name.description: Specifies the auto-follow pattern collection that you want to retrieve. If you do not specify a name, the API returns information for all collections.

clear_scroll#scroll_id.name: scroll_id
clear_scroll#scroll_id.description:
Comma-separated list of scroll IDs to clear.
To clear all scroll IDs, use `_all`.

cluster.allocation_explain#include_disk_.name: include_disk_info
cluster.allocation_explain#include_disk_.description: If true, returns information about disk usage and shard sizes.

cluster.allocation_explain#include_yes_d.name: include_yes_decisions
cluster.allocation_explain#include_yes_d.description: If true, returns YES decisions in explanation.

cluster.get_component_template#name.name: name
cluster.get_component_template#name.description:
Comma-separated list of component template names used to limit the request.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.

cluster.get_component_template#flat_sett.name: flat_settings
cluster.get_component_template#flat_sett.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

cluster.get_component_template#include_d.name: include_defaults
cluster.get_component_template#include_d.description: Return all default configurations for the component template (default: false)

cluster.get_component_template#local.name: local
cluster.get_component_template#local.description:
If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.
If `false`, information is retrieved from the master node.

cluster.get_component_template#master_ti.name: master_timeout
cluster.get_component_template#master_ti.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

cluster.health#index.name: index
cluster.health#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request. Wildcard expressions (*) are supported. To target all data streams and indices in a cluster, omit this parameter or use _all or *.

cluster.health#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
cluster.health#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

cluster.health#level.name: level
cluster.health#level.description: Can be one of cluster, indices or shards. Controls the details level of the health information returned.

cluster.health#local.name: local
cluster.health#local.description: If true, the request retrieves information from the local node only. Defaults to false, which means information is retrieved from the master node.

cluster.health#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
cluster.health#master_timeout.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

cluster.health#timeout.name: timeout
cluster.health#timeout.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

cluster.health#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
cluster.health#wait_for_active_shards.description: A number controlling to how many active shards to wait for, all to wait for all shards in the cluster to be active, or 0 to not wait.

cluster.health#wait_for_events.name: wait_for_events
cluster.health#wait_for_events.description: Can be one of immediate, urgent, high, normal, low, languid. Wait until all currently queued events with the given priority are processed.

cluster.health#wait_for_nodes.name: wait_for_nodes
cluster.health#wait_for_nodes.description: The request waits until the specified number N of nodes is available. It also accepts >=N, <=N, >N and <N. Alternatively, it is possible to use ge(N), le(N), gt(N) and lt(N) notation.

cluster.health#wait_for_no_initializing_.name: wait_for_no_initializing_shards
cluster.health#wait_for_no_initializing_.description: A boolean value which controls whether to wait (until the timeout provided) for the cluster to have no shard initializations. Defaults to false, which means it will not wait for initializing shards.

cluster.health#wait_for_no_relocating_sh.name: wait_for_no_relocating_shards
cluster.health#wait_for_no_relocating_sh.description: A boolean value which controls whether to wait (until the timeout provided) for the cluster to have no shard relocations. Defaults to false, which means it will not wait for relocating shards.

cluster.health#wait_for_status.name: wait_for_status
cluster.health#wait_for_status.description: One of green, yellow or red. Will wait (until the timeout provided) until the status of the cluster changes to the one provided or better, i.e. green > yellow > red. By default, will not wait for any status.

cluster.put_component_template#name.name: name
cluster.put_component_template#name.description:
Name of the component template to create.
Elasticsearch includes the following built-in component templates: `logs-mappings`; 'logs-settings`; `metrics-mappings`; `metrics-settings`;`synthetics-mapping`; `synthetics-settings`.
Elastic Agent uses these templates to configure backing indices for its data streams.
If you use Elastic Agent and want to overwrite one of these templates, set the `version` for your replacement template higher than the current version.
If you don’t use Elastic Agent and want to disable all built-in component and index templates, set `stack.templates.enabled` to `false` using the cluster update settings API.

cluster.put_component_template#create.name: create
cluster.put_component_template#create.description: If `true`, this request cannot replace or update existing component templates.

cluster.put_component_template#master_ti.name: master_timeout
cluster.put_component_template#master_ti.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

cluster.state#metric.name: metric
cluster.state#metric.description: Limit the information returned to the specified metrics

cluster.state#index.name: index
cluster.state#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

cluster.state#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
cluster.state#allow_no_indices.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

cluster.state#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
cluster.state#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

cluster.state#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
cluster.state#flat_settings.description: Return settings in flat format (default: false)

cluster.state#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
cluster.state#ignore_unavailable.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

cluster.state#local.name: local
cluster.state#local.description: Return local information, do not retrieve the state from master node (default: false)

cluster.state#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
cluster.state#master_timeout.description: Specify timeout for connection to master

cluster.state#wait_for_metadata_version.name: wait_for_metadata_version
cluster.state#wait_for_metadata_version.description: Wait for the metadata version to be equal or greater than the specified metadata version

cluster.state#wait_for_timeout.name: wait_for_timeout
cluster.state#wait_for_timeout.description: The maximum time to wait for wait_for_metadata_version before timing out

cluster.stats#node_id.name: node_id
cluster.stats#node_id.description: Comma-separated list of node filters used to limit returned information. Defaults to all nodes in the cluster.

cluster.stats#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
cluster.stats#flat_settings.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

cluster.stats#timeout.name: timeout
cluster.stats#timeout.description:
Period to wait for each node to respond.
If a node does not respond before its timeout expires, the response does not include its stats.
However, timed out nodes are included in the response’s `_nodes.failed` property. Defaults to no timeout.

connector.put#connector_id.name: connector_id
connector.put#connector_id.description: The unique identifier of the connector to be created or updated

count#index.name: index
count#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

count#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
count#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

count#analyzer.name: analyzer
count#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

count#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
count#analyze_wildcard.description:
If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

count#default_operator.name: default_operator
count#default_operator.description:
The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

count#df.name: df
count#df.description:
Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

count#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
count#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

count#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
count#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, concrete, expanded or aliased indices are ignored when frozen.

count#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
count#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

count#lenient.name: lenient
count#lenient.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

count#min_score.name: min_score
count#min_score.description: Sets the minimum `_score` value that documents must have to be included in the result.

count#preference.name: preference
count#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

count#routing.name: routing
count#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

count#terminate_after.name: terminate_after
count#terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early.
Elasticsearch collects documents before sorting.

count#q.name: q
count#q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax.

create#index.name: index
create#index.description:
Name of the data stream or index to target.
If the target doesn’t exist and matches the name or wildcard (`*`) pattern of an index template with a `data_stream` definition, this request creates the data stream.
If the target doesn’t exist and doesn’t match a data stream template, this request creates the index.

create#pipeline.name: pipeline
create#pipeline.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

create#refresh.name: refresh
create#refresh.description:
