If `true`, Elasticsearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` do nothing with refreshes.
Valid values: `true`, `false`, `wait_for`.

create#routing.name: routing
create#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

create#timeout.name: timeout
create#timeout.description: Period the request waits for the following operations: automatic index creation, dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

create#version.name: version
create#version.description:
Explicit version number for concurrency control.
The specified version must match the current version of the document for the request to succeed.

create#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
create#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

enrich.get_policy#name.name: name
enrich.get_policy#name.description:
Comma-separated list of enrich policy names used to limit the request.
To return information for all enrich policies, omit this parameter.

eql.search#index.name: index
eql.search#index.description: The name of the index to scope the operation

eql.search#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
eql.search#ignore_unavailable.description: If true, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

eql.search#keep_alive.name: keep_alive
eql.search#keep_alive.description: Period for which the search and its results are stored on the cluster.

eql.search#keep_on_completion.name: keep_on_completion
eql.search#keep_on_completion.description: If true, the search and its results are stored on the cluster.

eql.search#wait_for_completion_timeout.name: wait_for_completion_timeout
eql.search#wait_for_completion_timeout.description: Timeout duration to wait for the request to finish. Defaults to no timeout, meaning the request waits for complete search results.

explain#index.name: index
explain#index.description:
Index names used to limit the request.
Only a single index name can be provided to this parameter.

explain#analyzer.name: analyzer
explain#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

explain#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
explain#analyze_wildcard.description: If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.

explain#default_operator.name: default_operator
explain#default_operator.description: The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.

explain#df.name: df
explain#df.description: Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.

explain#lenient.name: lenient
explain#lenient.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

explain#preference.name: preference
explain#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

explain#routing.name: routing
explain#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

explain#_source.name: _source
explain#_source.description: True or false to return the `_source` field or not, or a list of fields to return.

explain#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
explain#_source_excludes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.

explain#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
explain#_source_includes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.

explain#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
explain#stored_fields.description: A comma-separated list of stored fields to return in the response.

explain#q.name: q
explain#q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax.

field_caps#index.name: index
field_caps#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request. Supports wildcards (*). To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use * or _all.

field_caps#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
field_caps#allow_no_indices.description:
If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias,
or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request
targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with foo but no index starts with bar.

field_caps#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
field_caps#expand_wildcards.description: Type of index that wildcard patterns can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams. Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

field_caps#fields.name: fields
field_caps#fields.description: Comma-separated list of fields to retrieve capabilities for. Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.

field_caps#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
field_caps#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

field_caps#include_unmapped.name: include_unmapped
field_caps#include_unmapped.description: If true, unmapped fields are included in the response.

field_caps#filters.name: filters
field_caps#filters.description: An optional set of filters: can include +metadata,-metadata,-nested,-multifield,-parent

field_caps#types.name: types
field_caps#types.description: Only return results for fields that have one of the types in the list

field_caps#include_empty_fields.name: include_empty_fields
field_caps#include_empty_fields.description: If false, empty fields are not included in the response.

fleet.msearch#index.name: index
fleet.msearch#index.description: A single target to search. If the target is an index alias, it must resolve to a single index.

fleet.msearch#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
fleet.msearch#allow_no_indices.description: If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or _all value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting foo*,bar* returns an error if an index starts with foo but no index starts with bar.

fleet.msearch#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
fleet.msearch#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network roundtrips between the coordinating node and remote clusters are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

fleet.msearch#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
fleet.msearch#expand_wildcards.description: Type of index that wildcard expressions can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.

fleet.msearch#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
fleet.msearch#ignore_throttled.description: If true, concrete, expanded or aliased indices are ignored when frozen.

fleet.msearch#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
fleet.msearch#ignore_unavailable.description: If true, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

fleet.msearch#max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
fleet.msearch#max_concurrent_searches.description: Maximum number of concurrent searches the multi search API can execute.

fleet.msearch#max_concurrent_shard_reque.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
fleet.msearch#max_concurrent_shard_reque.description: Maximum number of concurrent shard requests that each sub-search request executes per node.

fleet.msearch#pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size
fleet.msearch#pre_filter_shard_size.description: Defines a threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on its rewrite method i.e., if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

fleet.msearch#search_type.name: search_type
fleet.msearch#search_type.description: Indicates whether global term and document frequencies should be used when scoring returned documents.

fleet.msearch#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
fleet.msearch#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are returned as an integer in the response. Defaults to false, which returns an object.

fleet.msearch#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
fleet.msearch#typed_keys.description: Specifies whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

fleet.msearch#wait_for_checkpoints.name: wait_for_checkpoints
fleet.msearch#wait_for_checkpoints.description:
A comma separated list of checkpoints. When configured, the search API will only be executed on a shard
after the relevant checkpoint has become visible for search. Defaults to an empty list which will cause
Elasticsearch to immediately execute the search.

fleet.msearch#allow_partial_search_resul.name: allow_partial_search_results
fleet.msearch#allow_partial_search_resul.description:
If true, returns partial results if there are shard request timeouts or [shard failures](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-replication.html#shard-failures). If false, returns
an error with no partial results. Defaults to the configured cluster setting `search.default_allow_partial_results`
which is true by default.

fleet.search#index.name: index
fleet.search#index.description: A single target to search. If the target is an index alias, it must resolve to a single index.

fleet.search#suggest_field.name: suggest_field
fleet.search#suggest_field.description: Specifies which field to use for suggestions.

fleet.search#suggest_text.name: suggest_text
fleet.search#suggest_text.description: The source text for which the suggestions should be returned.

fleet.search#wait_for_checkpoints.name: wait_for_checkpoints
fleet.search#wait_for_checkpoints.description:
A comma separated list of checkpoints. When configured, the search API will only be executed on a shard
after the relevant checkpoint has become visible for search. Defaults to an empty list which will cause
Elasticsearch to immediately execute the search.

fleet.search#allow_partial_search_result.name: allow_partial_search_results
fleet.search#allow_partial_search_result.description:
If true, returns partial results if there are shard request timeouts or [shard failures](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-replication.html#shard-failures). If false, returns
an error with no partial results. Defaults to the configured cluster setting `search.default_allow_partial_results`
which is true by default.

graph.explore#routing.name: routing
graph.explore#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

graph.explore#timeout.name: timeout
graph.explore#timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
Defaults to no timeout.

health_report#feature.name: feature
health_report#feature.description: A feature of the cluster, as returned by the top-level health report API.

health_report#verbose.name: verbose
health_report#verbose.description: Opt-in for more information about the health of the system.

health_report#size.name: size
health_report#size.description: Limit the number of affected resources the health report API returns.

ilm.get_lifecycle#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
ilm.get_lifecycle#master_timeout.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

ilm.get_lifecycle#timeout.name: timeout
ilm.get_lifecycle#timeout.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

index#index.name: index
index#index.description: Name of the data stream or index to target.

index#if_primary_term.name: if_primary_term
index#if_primary_term.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this primary term.

index#if_seq_no.name: if_seq_no
index#if_seq_no.description: Only perform the operation if the document has this sequence number.

index#op_type.name: op_type
index#op_type.description:
Set to create to only index the document if it does not already exist (put if absent).
If a document with the specified `_id` already exists, the indexing operation will fail.
Same as using the `<index>/_create` endpoint.
Valid values: `index`, `create`.
If document id is specified, it defaults to `index`.
Otherwise, it defaults to `create`.

index#pipeline.name: pipeline
index#pipeline.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

index#refresh.name: refresh
index#refresh.description:
If `true`, Elasticsearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` do nothing with refreshes.
Valid values: `true`, `false`, `wait_for`.

index#routing.name: routing
index#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

index#timeout.name: timeout
index#timeout.description: Period the request waits for the following operations: automatic index creation, dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

index#version.name: version
index#version.description:
Explicit version number for concurrency control.
The specified version must match the current version of the document for the request to succeed.

index#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
index#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to all or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

index#require_alias.name: require_alias
index#require_alias.description: If `true`, the destination must be an index alias.

indices.analyze#index.name: index
indices.analyze#index.description:
Index used to derive the analyzer.
If specified, the `analyzer` or field parameter overrides this value.
If no index is specified or the index does not have a default analyzer, the analyze API uses the standard analyzer.

indices.clear_cache#index.name: index
indices.clear_cache#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.clear_cache#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.clear_cache#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.clear_cache#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.clear_cache#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.clear_cache#fielddata.name: fielddata
indices.clear_cache#fielddata.description:
If `true`, clears the fields cache.
Use the `fields` parameter to clear the cache of specific fields only.

indices.clear_cache#fields.name: fields
indices.clear_cache#fields.description: Comma-separated list of field names used to limit the `fielddata` parameter.

indices.clear_cache#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.clear_cache#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.clone#index.name: index
indices.clone#index.description: Name of the source index to clone.

indices.clone#target.name: target
indices.clone#target.description: Name of the target index to create.

indices.clone#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.clone#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.clone#timeout.name: timeout
indices.clone#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.clone#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
indices.clone#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

indices.data_streams_stats#name.name: name
indices.data_streams_stats#name.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams used to limit the request.
Wildcard expressions (`*`) are supported.
To target all data streams in a cluster, omit this parameter or use `*`.

indices.data_streams_stats#expand_wildca.name: expand_wildcards
indices.data_streams_stats#expand_wildca.description:
Type of data stream that wildcard patterns can match.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

indices.delete_alias#index.name: index
indices.delete_alias#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams or indices used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).

indices.delete_alias#name.name: name
indices.delete_alias#name.description:
Comma-separated list of aliases to remove.
Supports wildcards (`*`). To remove all aliases, use `*` or `_all`.

indices.delete_alias#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.delete_alias#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.delete_alias#timeout.name: timeout
indices.delete_alias#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.exists_alias#name.name: name
indices.exists_alias#name.description: Comma-separated list of aliases to check. Supports wildcards (`*`).

indices.exists_alias#index.name: index
indices.exists_alias#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams or indices used to limit the request. Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.exists_alias#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.exists_alias#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.exists_alias#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.exists_alias#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.exists_alias#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.exists_alias#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, requests that include a missing data stream or index in the target indices or data streams return an error.

indices.exists_alias#local.name: local
indices.exists_alias#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.flush#index.name: index
indices.flush#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to flush.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To flush all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.flush#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.flush#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.flush#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.flush#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.flush#force.name: force
indices.flush#force.description: If `true`, the request forces a flush even if there are no changes to commit to the index.

indices.flush#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.flush#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.flush#wait_if_ongoing.name: wait_if_ongoing
indices.flush#wait_if_ongoing.description:
If `true`, the flush operation blocks until execution when another flush operation is running.
If `false`, Elasticsearch returns an error if you request a flush when another flush operation is running.

indices.forcemerge#index.name: index
indices.forcemerge#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

indices.forcemerge#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.forcemerge#allow_no_indices.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

indices.forcemerge#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.forcemerge#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

indices.forcemerge#flush.name: flush
indices.forcemerge#flush.description: Specify whether the index should be flushed after performing the operation (default: true)

indices.forcemerge#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.forcemerge#ignore_unavailable.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

indices.forcemerge#max_num_segments.name: max_num_segments
indices.forcemerge#max_num_segments.description: The number of segments the index should be merged into (default: dynamic)

indices.forcemerge#only_expunge_deletes.name: only_expunge_deletes
indices.forcemerge#only_expunge_deletes.description: Specify whether the operation should only expunge deleted documents

indices.forcemerge#wait_for_completion.name: wait_for_completion
indices.forcemerge#wait_for_completion.description: Should the request wait until the force merge is completed.

indices.get_alias#name.name: name
indices.get_alias#name.description:
Comma-separated list of aliases to retrieve.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To retrieve all aliases, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_alias#index.name: index
indices.get_alias#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams or indices used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_alias#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.get_alias#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.get_alias#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_alias#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.get_alias#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.get_alias#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.get_alias#local.name: local
indices.get_alias#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.get_data_stream#name.name: name
indices.get_data_stream#name.description:
Comma-separated list of data stream names used to limit the request.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported. If omitted, all data streams are returned.

indices.get_data_stream#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_data_stream#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of data stream that wildcard patterns can match.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

indices.get_data_stream#include_defaults.name: include_defaults
indices.get_data_stream#include_defaults.description: If true, returns all relevant default configurations for the index template.

indices.get_field_mapping#fields.name: fields
indices.get_field_mapping#fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expression of fields used to limit returned information.

indices.get_field_mapping#index.name: index
indices.get_field_mapping#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_field_mapping#allow_no_indic.name: allow_no_indices
indices.get_field_mapping#allow_no_indic.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.get_field_mapping#expand_wildcar.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_field_mapping#expand_wildcar.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.get_field_mapping#ignore_unavail.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.get_field_mapping#ignore_unavail.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.get_field_mapping#include_defaul.name: include_defaults
indices.get_field_mapping#include_defaul.description: If `true`, return all default settings in the response.

indices.get_field_mapping#local.name: local
indices.get_field_mapping#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.get_index_template#name.name: name
indices.get_index_template#name.description: Comma-separated list of index template names used to limit the request. Wildcard (*) expressions are supported.

indices.get_index_template#local.name: local
indices.get_index_template#local.description: If true, the request retrieves information from the local node only. Defaults to false, which means information is retrieved from the master node.

indices.get_index_template#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
indices.get_index_template#flat_settings.description: If true, returns settings in flat format.

indices.get_index_template#master_timeou.name: master_timeout
indices.get_index_template#master_timeou.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.get_index_template#include_defau.name: include_defaults
indices.get_index_template#include_defau.description: If true, returns all relevant default configurations for the index template.

indices.get_mapping#index.name: index
indices.get_mapping#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_mapping#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.get_mapping#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.get_mapping#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_mapping#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.get_mapping#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.get_mapping#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.get_mapping#local.name: local
indices.get_mapping#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.get_mapping#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.get_mapping#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.get_settings#index.name: index
indices.get_settings#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit
the request. Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and
indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_settings#name.name: name
indices.get_settings#name.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expression of settings to retrieve.

indices.get_settings#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.get_settings#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index
alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This
behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For
example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index
starts with foo but no index starts with `bar`.

indices.get_settings#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_settings#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

indices.get_settings#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
indices.get_settings#flat_settings.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

indices.get_settings#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.get_settings#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.get_settings#include_defaults.name: include_defaults
indices.get_settings#include_defaults.description: If `true`, return all default settings in the response.

indices.get_settings#local.name: local
indices.get_settings#local.description:
If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only. If
`false`, information is retrieved from the master node.

indices.get_settings#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.get_settings#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is
received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an
error.

indices.get_template#name.name: name
indices.get_template#name.description:
Comma-separated list of index template names used to limit the request.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To return all index templates, omit this parameter or use a value of `_all` or `*`.

indices.get_template#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
indices.get_template#flat_settings.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

indices.get_template#local.name: local
indices.get_template#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.get_template#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.get_template#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_alias#index.name: index
indices.put_alias#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams or indices to add.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
Wildcard patterns that match both data streams and indices return an error.

indices.put_alias#name.name: name
indices.put_alias#name.description:
Alias to update.
If the alias doesn’t exist, the request creates it.
Index alias names support date math.

indices.put_alias#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.put_alias#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_alias#timeout.name: timeout
indices.put_alias#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_index_template#create.name: create
indices.put_index_template#create.description: If `true`, this request cannot replace or update existing index templates.

indices.put_index_template#master_timeou.name: master_timeout
indices.put_index_template#master_timeou.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_index_template#cause.name: cause
indices.put_index_template#cause.description: User defined reason for creating/updating the index template

indices.put_mapping#index.name: index
indices.put_mapping#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names the mapping should be added to (supports wildcards); use `_all` or omit to add the mapping on all indices.

indices.put_mapping#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.put_mapping#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.put_mapping#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.put_mapping#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.put_mapping#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.put_mapping#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.put_mapping#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.put_mapping#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_mapping#timeout.name: timeout
indices.put_mapping#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_mapping#write_index_only.name: write_index_only
indices.put_mapping#write_index_only.description: If `true`, the mappings are applied only to the current write index for the target.

indices.put_settings#index.name: index
indices.put_settings#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit
the request. Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and
indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.put_settings#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.put_settings#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index
alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This
behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For
example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index
starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

indices.put_settings#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.put_settings#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match. If the request can target
data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match
hidden data streams. Supports comma-separated values, such as
`open,hidden`.

indices.put_settings#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
indices.put_settings#flat_settings.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

indices.put_settings#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.put_settings#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

indices.put_settings#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.put_settings#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is
received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an
error.

indices.put_settings#preserve_existing.name: preserve_existing
indices.put_settings#preserve_existing.description: If `true`, existing index settings remain unchanged.

indices.put_settings#timeout.name: timeout
indices.put_settings#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the
 timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_template#create.name: create
indices.put_template#create.description: If true, this request cannot replace or update existing index templates.

indices.put_template#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.put_template#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is
received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_template#order.name: order
indices.put_template#order.description:
Order in which Elasticsearch applies this template if index
matches multiple templates.

Templates with lower 'order' values are merged first. Templates with higher
'order' values are merged later, overriding templates with lower values.

indices.recovery#index.name: index
indices.recovery#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.recovery#active_only.name: active_only
indices.recovery#active_only.description: If `true`, the response only includes ongoing shard recoveries.

indices.recovery#detailed.name: detailed
indices.recovery#detailed.description: If `true`, the response includes detailed information about shard recoveries.

indices.refresh#index.name: index
indices.refresh#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.refresh#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.refresh#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.refresh#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.refresh#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.refresh#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.refresh#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.reload_search_analyzers#index.name: index
indices.reload_search_analyzers#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names to reload analyzers for

indices.reload_search_analyzers#allow_no.name: allow_no_indices
indices.reload_search_analyzers#allow_no.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

indices.reload_search_analyzers#expand_w.name: expand_wildcards
indices.reload_search_analyzers#expand_w.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

indices.reload_search_analyzers#ignore_u.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.reload_search_analyzers#ignore_u.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

indices.rollover#alias.name: alias
indices.rollover#alias.description: Name of the data stream or index alias to roll over.

indices.rollover#new_index.name: new_index
indices.rollover#new_index.description:
Name of the index to create.
Supports date math.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

indices.rollover#dry_run.name: dry_run
indices.rollover#dry_run.description: If `true`, checks whether the current index satisfies the specified conditions but does not perform a rollover.

indices.rollover#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.rollover#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.rollover#timeout.name: timeout
indices.rollover#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.rollover#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
indices.rollover#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to all or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

indices.segments#index.name: index
indices.segments#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.segments#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.segments#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.segments#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.segments#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.segments#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.segments#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.segments#verbose.name: verbose
indices.segments#verbose.description: If `true`, the request returns a verbose response.

indices.shard_stores#index.name: index
indices.shard_stores#index.description: List of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.

indices.shard_stores#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.shard_stores#allow_no_indices.description:
If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or _all
value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request
targets other open indices.

indices.shard_stores#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.shard_stores#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match. If the request can target data streams,
this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.

indices.shard_stores#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.shard_stores#ignore_unavailable.description: If true, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

indices.shard_stores#status.name: status
indices.shard_stores#status.description: List of shard health statuses used to limit the request.

indices.shrink#index.name: index
indices.shrink#index.description: Name of the source index to shrink.

indices.shrink#target.name: target
indices.shrink#target.description: Name of the target index to create.

indices.shrink#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.shrink#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.shrink#timeout.name: timeout
indices.shrink#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.shrink#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
indices.shrink#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

indices.simulate_template#name.name: name
indices.simulate_template#name.description:
Name of the index template to simulate. To test a template configuration before you add it to the cluster, omit
this parameter and specify the template configuration in the request body.

indices.simulate_template#create.name: create
indices.simulate_template#create.description: If true, the template passed in the body is only used if no existing templates match the same index patterns. If false, the simulation uses the template with the highest priority. Note that the template is not permanently added or updated in either case; it is only used for the simulation.

indices.simulate_template#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.simulate_template#master_timeout.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.simulate_template#include_defaul.name: include_defaults
indices.simulate_template#include_defaul.description: If true, returns all relevant default configurations for the index template.

indices.split#index.name: index
indices.split#index.description: Name of the source index to split.

indices.split#target.name: target
indices.split#target.description: Name of the target index to create.

indices.split#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.split#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.split#timeout.name: timeout
indices.split#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.split#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
indices.split#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

indices.stats#metric.name: metric
indices.stats#metric.description: Limit the information returned the specific metrics.

indices.stats#index.name: index
indices.stats#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

indices.stats#completion_fields.name: completion_fields
indices.stats#completion_fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in fielddata and suggest statistics.

indices.stats#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.stats#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument
determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams. Supports comma-separated values,
such as `open,hidden`.

indices.stats#fielddata_fields.name: fielddata_fields
indices.stats#fielddata_fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in fielddata statistics.

indices.stats#fields.name: fields
indices.stats#fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.

indices.stats#forbid_closed_indices.name: forbid_closed_indices
indices.stats#forbid_closed_indices.description: If true, statistics are not collected from closed indices.

indices.stats#groups.name: groups
indices.stats#groups.description: Comma-separated list of search groups to include in the search statistics.

indices.stats#include_segment_file_sizes.name: include_segment_file_sizes
indices.stats#include_segment_file_sizes.description: If true, the call reports the aggregated disk usage of each one of the Lucene index files (only applies if segment stats are requested).

indices.stats#include_unloaded_segments.name: include_unloaded_segments
indices.stats#include_unloaded_segments.description: If true, the response includes information from segments that are not loaded into memory.

indices.stats#level.name: level
indices.stats#level.description: Indicates whether statistics are aggregated at the cluster, index, or shard level.

indices.validate_query#index.name: index
indices.validate_query#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams or indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.validate_query#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.validate_query#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.validate_query#all_shards.name: all_shards
indices.validate_query#all_shards.description: If `true`, the validation is executed on all shards instead of one random shard per index.

indices.validate_query#analyzer.name: analyzer
indices.validate_query#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

indices.validate_query#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
indices.validate_query#analyze_wildcard.description: If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.

indices.validate_query#default_operator.name: default_operator
indices.validate_query#default_operator.description: The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.

indices.validate_query#df.name: df
indices.validate_query#df.description:
Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

indices.validate_query#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.validate_query#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.validate_query#explain.name: explain
indices.validate_query#explain.description: If `true`, the response returns detailed information if an error has occurred.

indices.validate_query#ignore_unavailabl.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.validate_query#ignore_unavailabl.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.validate_query#lenient.name: lenient
indices.validate_query#lenient.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

indices.validate_query#rewrite.name: rewrite
indices.validate_query#rewrite.description: If `true`, returns a more detailed explanation showing the actual Lucene query that will be executed.

indices.validate_query#q.name: q
indices.validate_query#q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax.

inference.delete#dry_run.name: dry_run
inference.delete#dry_run.description: When true, the endpoint is not deleted, and a list of ingest processors which reference this endpoint is returned

inference.delete#force.name: force
inference.delete#force.description: When true, the inference endpoint is forcefully deleted even if it is still being used by ingest processors or semantic text fields

inference.inference#timeout.name: timeout
inference.inference#timeout.description: Specifies the amount of time to wait for the inference request to complete.

ingest.get_pipeline#id.name: id
ingest.get_pipeline#id.description:
Comma-separated list of pipeline IDs to retrieve.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To get all ingest pipelines, omit this parameter or use `*`.

ingest.get_pipeline#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
ingest.get_pipeline#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

ingest.get_pipeline#summary.name: summary
ingest.get_pipeline#summary.description: Return pipelines without their definitions (default: false)

ingest.simulate#id.name: id
ingest.simulate#id.description:
Pipeline to test.
If you don’t specify a `pipeline` in the request body, this parameter is required.

ingest.simulate#verbose.name: verbose
ingest.simulate#verbose.description: If `true`, the response includes output data for each processor in the executed pipeline.

knn_search#index.name: index
knn_search#index.description:
A comma-separated list of index names to search;
use `_all` or to perform the operation on all indices

knn_search#routing.name: routing
knn_search#routing.description: A comma-separated list of specific routing values

license.post#acknowledge.name: acknowledge
license.post#acknowledge.description: Specifies whether you acknowledge the license changes.

mget#index.name: index
mget#index.description: Name of the index to retrieve documents from when `ids` are specified, or when a document in the `docs` array does not specify an index.

mget#force_synthetic_source.name: force_synthetic_source
mget#force_synthetic_source.description:
Should this request force synthetic _source?
Use this to test if the mapping supports synthetic _source and to get a sense of the worst case performance.
Fetches with this enabled will be slower the enabling synthetic source natively in the index.

mget#preference.name: preference
mget#preference.description: Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on. Random by default.

mget#realtime.name: realtime
mget#realtime.description: If `true`, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

mget#refresh.name: refresh
mget#refresh.description: If `true`, the request refreshes relevant shards before retrieving documents.

mget#routing.name: routing
mget#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

mget#_source.name: _source
mget#_source.description: True or false to return the `_source` field or not, or a list of fields to return.

mget#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
mget#_source_excludes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.
You can also use this parameter to exclude fields from the subset specified in `_source_includes` query parameter.

mget#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
mget#_source_includes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.
If this parameter is specified, only these source fields are returned. You can exclude fields from this subset using the `_source_excludes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

mget#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
mget#stored_fields.description: If `true`, retrieves the document fields stored in the index rather than the document `_source`.

migration.deprecations#index.name: index
migration.deprecations#index.description: Comma-separate list of data streams or indices to check. Wildcard (*) expressions are supported.

ml.delete_expired_data#job_id.name: job_id
ml.delete_expired_data#job_id.description:
Identifier for an anomaly detection job. It can be a job identifier, a
group name, or a wildcard expression.

ml.delete_expired_data#requests_per_seco.name: requests_per_second
ml.delete_expired_data#requests_per_seco.description:
The desired requests per second for the deletion processes. The default
behavior is no throttling.

ml.delete_expired_data#timeout.name: timeout
ml.delete_expired_data#timeout.description: How long can the underlying delete processes run until they are canceled.

ml.delete_forecast#job_id.name: job_id
ml.delete_forecast#job_id.description: Identifier for the anomaly detection job.

ml.delete_forecast#forecast_id.name: forecast_id
ml.delete_forecast#forecast_id.description:
A comma-separated list of forecast identifiers. If you do not specify
this optional parameter or if you specify `_all` or `*` the API deletes
all forecasts from the job.

ml.delete_forecast#allow_no_forecasts.name: allow_no_forecasts
ml.delete_forecast#allow_no_forecasts.description:
Specifies whether an error occurs when there are no forecasts. In
particular, if this parameter is set to `false` and there are no
forecasts associated with the job, attempts to delete all forecasts
return an error.

ml.delete_forecast#timeout.name: timeout
ml.delete_forecast#timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for the completion of the delete
operation. When this period of time elapses, the API fails and returns an
error.

ml.explain_data_frame_analytics#id.name: id
ml.explain_data_frame_analytics#id.description:
Identifier for the data frame analytics job. This identifier can contain
lowercase alphanumeric characters (a-z and 0-9), hyphens, and
underscores. It must start and end with alphanumeric characters.

ml.get_buckets#job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_buckets#job_id.description: Identifier for the anomaly detection job.

ml.get_buckets#timestamp.name: timestamp
ml.get_buckets#timestamp.description:
The timestamp of a single bucket result. If you do not specify this
parameter, the API returns information about all buckets.

ml.get_buckets#anomaly_score.name: anomaly_score
ml.get_buckets#anomaly_score.description: Returns buckets with anomaly scores greater or equal than this value.

ml.get_buckets#desc.name: desc
ml.get_buckets#desc.description: If `true`, the buckets are sorted in descending order.

ml.get_buckets#end.name: end
ml.get_buckets#end.description:
Returns buckets with timestamps earlier than this time. `-1` means it is
unset and results are not limited to specific timestamps.

ml.get_buckets#exclude_interim.name: exclude_interim
ml.get_buckets#exclude_interim.description: If `true`, the output excludes interim results.

ml.get_buckets#expand.name: expand
ml.get_buckets#expand.description: If true, the output includes anomaly records.

ml.get_buckets#from.name: from
ml.get_buckets#from.description: Skips the specified number of buckets.

ml.get_buckets#size.name: size
ml.get_buckets#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of buckets to obtain.

ml.get_buckets#sort.name: sort
ml.get_buckets#sort.description: Specifies the sort field for the requested buckets.

ml.get_buckets#start.name: start
ml.get_buckets#start.description:
Returns buckets with timestamps after this time. `-1` means it is unset
and results are not limited to specific timestamps.

ml.get_calendars#calendar_id.name: calendar_id
ml.get_calendars#calendar_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies a calendar. You can get information for multiple calendars by using a comma-separated list of ids or a wildcard expression. You can get information for all calendars by using `_all` or `*` or by omitting the calendar identifier.

ml.get_calendars#from.name: from
ml.get_calendars#from.description: Skips the specified number of calendars. This parameter is supported only when you omit the calendar identifier.

ml.get_calendars#size.name: size
ml.get_calendars#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of calendars to obtain. This parameter is supported only when you omit the calendar identifier.

ml.get_categories#job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_categories#job_id.description: Identifier for the anomaly detection job.

ml.get_categories#category_id.name: category_id
ml.get_categories#category_id.description:
Identifier for the category, which is unique in the job. If you specify
neither the category ID nor the partition_field_value, the API returns
information about all categories. If you specify only the
partition_field_value, it returns information about all categories for
the specified partition.

ml.get_categories#from.name: from
ml.get_categories#from.description: Skips the specified number of categories.

ml.get_categories#partition_field_value.name: partition_field_value
ml.get_categories#partition_field_value.description: Only return categories for the specified partition.

ml.get_categories#size.name: size
ml.get_categories#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of categories to obtain.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics#id.name: id
ml.get_data_frame_analytics#id.description:
Identifier for the data frame analytics job. If you do not specify this
option, the API returns information for the first hundred data frame
analytics jobs.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics#allow_no_mat.name: allow_no_match

If this parameter is `false`, the request returns a 404 status code when
there are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_datafeeds#datafeed_id.name: datafeed_id

ml.get_influencers#job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_influencers#job_id.description: Identifier for the anomaly detection job.

ml.get_job_stats#job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_job_stats#job_id.description:
Identifier for the anomaly detection job. It can be a job identifier, a
group name, a comma-separated list of jobs, or a wildcard expression. If
you do not specify one of these options, the API returns information for
all anomaly detection jobs.

ml.get_job_stats#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_job_stats#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no jobs that match.
2. Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If `true`, the API returns an empty `jobs` array when
there are no matches and the subset of results when there are partial
matches. If `false`, the API returns a `404` status
code when there are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_jobs#job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_jobs#job_id.description:
Identifier for the anomaly detection job. It can be a job identifier, a
group name, or a wildcard expression. If you do not specify one of these
options, the API returns information for all anomaly detection jobs.

ml.get_jobs#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_jobs#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no jobs that match.
2. Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.

ml.get_jobs#exclude_generated.name: exclude_generated

ml.get_memory_stats#node_id.description:

`ml:true`

ml.get_memory_stats#human.name: human
ml.get_memory_stats#human.description:
Specify this query parameter to include the fields with units in the response. Otherwise only
the `_in_bytes` sizes are returned in the response.

ml.get_memory_stats#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
ml.get_memory_stats#master_timeout.description:

ml.get_memory_stats#timeout.name: timeout
ml.get_memory_stats#timeout.description:

ml.get_model_snapshots#job_id.description: Identifier for the anomaly detection job.

ml.get_model_snapshots#snapshot_id.name: snapshot_id
ml.get_model_snapshots#snapshot_id.description:
A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the model snapshot. You can get information for multiple
snapshots by using a comma-separated list or a wildcard expression. You can get all snapshots by using `_all`,
by specifying `*` as the snapshot ID, or by omitting the snapshot ID.

ml.get_model_snapshots#desc.name: desc
ml.get_model_snapshots#desc.description: If true, the results are sorted in descending order.

ml.get_model_snapshots#end.name: end
ml.get_model_snapshots#end.description: Returns snapshots with timestamps earlier than this time.

ml.get_model_snapshots#from.name: from
ml.get_model_snapshots#from.description: Skips the specified number of snapshots.

ml.get_model_snapshots#size.name: size
ml.get_model_snapshots#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of snapshots to obtain.

ml.get_model_snapshots#sort.name: sort

snapshots are sorted by their timestamp.

ml.get_model_snapshots#start.name: start
ml.get_model_snapshots#start.description: Returns snapshots with timestamps after this time.

ml.get_overall_buckets#job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_overall_buckets#job_id.description:
Identifier for the anomaly detection job. It can be a job identifier, a
group name, a comma-separated list of jobs or groups, or a wildcard
expression.

You can summarize the bucket results for all anomaly detection jobs by
using `_all` or by specifying `*` as the `<job_id>`.

ml.get_overall_buckets#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_overall_buckets#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no jobs that match.
2. Contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If `true`, the request returns an empty `jobs` array when there are no
matches and the subset of results when there are partial matches. If this
parameter is `false`, the request returns a `404` status code when there
are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_overall_buckets#bucket_span.name: bucket_span
ml.get_overall_buckets#bucket_span.description:
The span of the overall buckets. Must be greater or equal to the largest
bucket span of the specified anomaly detection jobs, which is the default
value.

By default, an overall bucket has a span equal to the largest bucket span
of the specified anomaly detection jobs. To override that behavior, use
the optional `bucket_span` parameter.

ml.get_overall_buckets#end.name: end
ml.get_overall_buckets#end.description: Returns overall buckets with timestamps earlier than this time.

ml.get_overall_buckets#exclude_interim.name: exclude_interim
ml.get_overall_buckets#exclude_interim.description: If `true`, the output excludes interim results.

ml.get_overall_buckets#overall_score.name: overall_score
ml.get_overall_buckets#overall_score.description:

value.

ml.get_overall_buckets#start.name: start
ml.get_overall_buckets#start.description: Returns overall buckets with timestamps after this time.

ml.get_overall_buckets#top_n.name: top_n
ml.get_overall_buckets#top_n.description:
The number of top anomaly detection job bucket scores to be used in the
`overall_score` calculation.

ml.get_records#job_id.description: Identifier for the anomaly detection job.

ml.get_trained_models#allow_no_match.description:

ml.get_trained_models#exclude_generated.name: exclude_generated

ml.get_trained_models#size.name: size
ml.get_trained_models#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of models to obtain.

ml.get_trained_models#tags.name: tags

ml.get_trained_models_stats#model_id.name: model_id
ml.get_trained_models_stats#model_id.description:

ml.get_trained_models_stats#allow_no_mat.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_trained_models_stats#allow_no_mat.description:

- Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If true, it returns an empty array when there are no matches and the

ml.get_trained_models_stats#from.name: from

alphanumeric characters (a-z and 0-9), hyphens, and underscores. It must start and end with alphanumeric
characters. NOTE: If you use this path parameter, you cannot provide datafeed or anomaly detection job
configuration details in the request body.

ml.preview_datafeed#start.name: start
ml.preview_datafeed#start.description: The start time from where the datafeed preview should begin

ml.preview_datafeed#end.name: end

monitoring.bulk#type.name: type
monitoring.bulk#type.description: Default document type for items which don't provide one

monitoring.bulk#interval.name: interval
monitoring.bulk#interval.description: Collection interval (e.g., '10s' or '10000ms') of the payload

msearch#index.name: index
msearch#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases to search.

msearch#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
msearch#allow_no_indices.description: If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or _all value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting foo*,bar* returns an error if an index starts with foo but no index starts with bar.

msearch#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
msearch#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network roundtrips between the coordinating node and remote clusters are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

msearch#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
msearch#expand_wildcards.description: Type of index that wildcard expressions can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.

msearch#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
msearch#ignore_throttled.description: If true, concrete, expanded or aliased indices are ignored when frozen.

msearch#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
msearch#ignore_unavailable.description: If true, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

msearch#max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
msearch#max_concurrent_searches.description: Maximum number of concurrent searches the multi search API can execute.

msearch#max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
msearch#max_concurrent_shard_requests.description: Maximum number of concurrent shard requests that each sub-search request executes per node.

msearch#pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size
msearch#pre_filter_shard_size.description: Defines a threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on its rewrite method i.e., if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

msearch#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
msearch#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are returned as an integer in the response. Defaults to false, which returns an object.

msearch#routing.name: routing
msearch#routing.description: Custom routing value used to route search operations to a specific shard.

msearch#search_type.name: search_type
msearch#search_type.description: Indicates whether global term and document frequencies should be used when scoring returned documents.

msearch#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
msearch#typed_keys.description: Specifies whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

msearch_template#index.name: index
msearch_template#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*`.

msearch_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
msearch_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

msearch_template#max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
msearch_template#max_concurrent_searches.description: Maximum number of concurrent searches the API can run.

msearch_template#search_type.name: search_type
msearch_template#search_type.description:
The type of the search operation.
Available options: `query_then_fetch`, `dfs_query_then_fetch`.

msearch_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
msearch_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.description:
If `true`, the response returns `hits.total` as an integer.
If `false`, it returns `hits.total` as an object.

msearch_template#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
msearch_template#typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

mtermvectors#index.name: index
mtermvectors#index.description: Name of the index that contains the documents.

mtermvectors#ids.name: ids
mtermvectors#ids.description: A comma-separated list of documents ids. You must define ids as parameter or set "ids" or "docs" in the request body

mtermvectors#fields.name: fields
mtermvectors#fields.description:
Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.
Used as the default list unless a specific field list is provided in the `completion_fields` or `fielddata_fields` parameters.

mtermvectors#field_statistics.name: field_statistics
mtermvectors#field_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes the document count, sum of document frequencies, and sum of total term frequencies.

mtermvectors#offsets.name: offsets
mtermvectors#offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

mtermvectors#payloads.name: payloads
mtermvectors#payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

mtermvectors#positions.name: positions
mtermvectors#positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

mtermvectors#preference.name: preference
mtermvectors#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

mtermvectors#realtime.name: realtime
mtermvectors#realtime.description: If true, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

mtermvectors#routing.name: routing
mtermvectors#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

mtermvectors#term_statistics.name: term_statistics
mtermvectors#term_statistics.description: If true, the response includes term frequency and document frequency.

mtermvectors#version.name: version
mtermvectors#version.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

nodes.hot_threads#node_id.name: node_id
nodes.hot_threads#node_id.description: List of node IDs or names used to limit returned information.

nodes.hot_threads#ignore_idle_threads.name: ignore_idle_threads
nodes.hot_threads#ignore_idle_threads.description:

a task from an empty queue) are filtered out.

nodes.hot_threads#interval.name: interval
nodes.hot_threads#interval.description: The interval to do the second sampling of threads.

nodes.hot_threads#snapshots.name: snapshots

nodes.hot_threads#master_timeout.name: master_timeout

is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and
returns an error.

nodes.hot_threads#threads.name: threads

nodes.hot_threads#timeout.name: timeout
nodes.hot_threads#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response. If no response is received
before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

nodes.hot_threads#sort.name: sort
nodes.hot_threads#sort.description: The sort order for 'cpu' type (default: total)

nodes.info#node_id.name: node_id
nodes.info#node_id.description: Comma-separated list of node IDs or names used to limit returned information.

nodes.info#metric.name: metric
nodes.info#metric.description: Limits the information returned to the specific metrics. Supports a comma-separated list, such as http,ingest.

nodes.info#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
nodes.info#flat_settings.description: If true, returns settings in flat format.

nodes.info#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
nodes.info#master_timeout.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

nodes.info#timeout.name: timeout
nodes.info#timeout.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

nodes.reload_secure_settings#node_id.name: node_id
nodes.reload_secure_settings#node_id.description: The names of particular nodes in the cluster to target.

nodes.reload_secure_settings#timeout.name: timeout
nodes.reload_secure_settings#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

nodes.stats#node_id.name: node_id
nodes.stats#node_id.description: Comma-separated list of node IDs or names used to limit returned information.

nodes.stats#metric.name: metric
nodes.stats#metric.description: Limit the information returned to the specified metrics

nodes.stats#index_metric.name: index_metric
nodes.stats#index_metric.description: Limit the information returned for indices metric to the specific index metrics. It can be used only if indices (or all) metric is specified.

nodes.stats#completion_fields.name: completion_fields
