nodes.stats#fielddata_fields.name: fielddata_fields
nodes.stats#fielddata_fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in fielddata statistics.

nodes.stats#fields.name: fields
nodes.stats#fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.

nodes.stats#groups.name: groups
nodes.stats#groups.description: Comma-separated list of search groups to include in the search statistics.

nodes.stats#include_segment_file_sizes.name: include_segment_file_sizes
nodes.stats#include_segment_file_sizes.description: If true, the call reports the aggregated disk usage of each one of the Lucene index files (only applies if segment stats are requested).

nodes.stats#level.name: level
nodes.stats#level.description: Indicates whether statistics are aggregated at the cluster, index, or shard level.

nodes.stats#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
nodes.stats#master_timeout.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

nodes.stats#timeout.name: timeout
nodes.stats#timeout.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

nodes.stats#types.name: types
nodes.stats#types.description: A comma-separated list of document types for the indexing index metric.

nodes.stats#include_unloaded_segments.name: include_unloaded_segments
nodes.stats#include_unloaded_segments.description: If `true`, the response includes information from segments that are not loaded into memory.

nodes.usage#node_id.name: node_id
nodes.usage#node_id.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs or names to limit the returned information; use `_local` to return information from the node you're connecting to, leave empty to get information from all nodes

nodes.usage#metric.name: metric
nodes.usage#metric.description:
Limits the information returned to the specific metrics.
A comma-separated list of the following options: `_all`, `rest_actions`.

nodes.usage#timeout.name: timeout
nodes.usage#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

put_script#id.name: id
put_script#id.description:
Identifier for the stored script or search template.
Must be unique within the cluster.

put_script#context.name: context
put_script#context.description:
Context in which the script or search template should run.
To prevent errors, the API immediately compiles the script or template in this context.

put_script#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
put_script#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

put_script#timeout.name: timeout
put_script#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

rank_eval#index.name: index
rank_eval#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request. Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To target all data streams and indices in a cluster, omit this parameter or use `_all` or `*`.

rank_eval#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
rank_eval#allow_no_indices.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

rank_eval#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
rank_eval#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

rank_eval#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
rank_eval#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

render_search_template#id.name: id
render_search_template#id.description:
ID of the search template to render.
If no `source` is specified, this or the `id` request body parameter is required.

rollup.get_jobs#id.name: id
rollup.get_jobs#id.description:
Identifier for the rollup job.
If it is `_all` or omitted, the API returns all rollup jobs.

rollup.get_rollup_caps#id.name: id
rollup.get_rollup_caps#id.description:
Index, indices or index-pattern to return rollup capabilities for.
`_all` may be used to fetch rollup capabilities from all jobs.

rollup.rollup_search#index.name: index
rollup.rollup_search#index.description: Enables searching rolled-up data using the standard Query DSL.

rollup.rollup_search#rest_total_hits_as_.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
rollup.rollup_search#rest_total_hits_as_.description: Indicates whether hits.total should be rendered as an integer or an object in the rest search response

rollup.rollup_search#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
rollup.rollup_search#typed_keys.description: Specify whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response

scroll#scroll.name: scroll
scroll#scroll.description: Period to retain the search context for scrolling.

scroll#scroll_id_.name: scroll_id
scroll#scroll_id_.description: The scroll ID for scrolled search

scroll#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
scroll#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, the API response’s hit.total property is returned as an integer. If false, the API response’s hit.total property is returned as an object.

search#index.name: index
search#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

search#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search#allow_partial_search_results.name: allow_partial_search_results
search#allow_partial_search_results.description: If true, returns partial results if there are shard request timeouts or shard failures. If false, returns an error with no partial results.

search#analyzer.name: analyzer
search#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
search#analyze_wildcard.description:
If true, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#batched_reduce_size.name: batched_reduce_size
search#batched_reduce_size.description:
The number of shard results that should be reduced at once on the coordinating node.
This value should be used as a protection mechanism to reduce the memory overhead per search request if the potential number of shards in the request can be large.

search#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network round-trips between the coordinating node and the remote clusters are minimized when executing cross-cluster search (CCS) requests.

search#default_operator.name: default_operator
search#default_operator.description:
The default operator for query string query: AND or OR.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search#df.name: df
search#df.description:
Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#docvalue_fields.name: docvalue_fields
search#docvalue_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return as the docvalue representation for each hit.

search#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

search#explain.name: explain
search#explain.description: If `true`, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

search#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, concrete, expanded or aliased indices will be ignored when frozen.

search#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search#lenient.name: lenient
search#lenient.description:
If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search#max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
search#max_concurrent_shard_requests.description:
Defines the number of concurrent shard requests per node this search executes concurrently.
This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests.

search#min_compatible_shard_node.name: min_compatible_shard_node
search#min_compatible_shard_node.description:
The minimum version of the node that can handle the request
Any handling node with a lower version will fail the request.

search#preference.name: preference

search#pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size

search#request_cache.name: request_cache
search#request_cache.description:
If `true`, the caching of search results is enabled for requests where `size` is `0`.
Defaults to index level settings.

search#routing.name: routing
search#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search#scroll.name: scroll
search#scroll.description:
Period to retain the search context for scrolling. See Scroll search results.
By default, this value cannot exceed `1d` (24 hours).
You can change this limit using the `search.max_keep_alive` cluster-level setting.

search#search_type.name: search_type
search#search_type.description: How distributed term frequencies are calculated for relevance scoring.

search#stats.name: stats
search#stats.description: Specific `tag` of the request for logging and statistical purposes.

search#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
search#stored_fields.description:
A comma-separated list of stored fields to return as part of a hit.
If no fields are specified, no stored fields are included in the response.
If this field is specified, the `_source` parameter defaults to `false`.
You can pass `_source: true` to return both source fields and stored fields in the search response.

search#suggest_field.name: suggest_field
search#suggest_field.description: Specifies which field to use for suggestions.

search#suggest_mode.name: suggest_mode
search#suggest_mode.description:
Specifies the suggest mode.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#suggest_size.name: suggest_size
search#suggest_size.description:
Number of suggestions to return.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#suggest_text.name: suggest_text
search#suggest_text.description:
The source text for which the suggestions should be returned.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#terminate_after.name: terminate_after
search#terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early.
Elasticsearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Elasticsearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Elasticsearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

search#timeout.name: timeout
search#timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

search#track_total_hits.name: track_total_hits
search#track_total_hits.description:
Number of hits matching the query to count accurately.
If `true`, the exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
If `false`, the response does not include the total number of hits matching the query.

search#track_scores.name: track_scores
search#track_scores.description: If `true`, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

search#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search#typed_keys.description: If `true`, aggregation and suggester names are be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

search#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: Indicates whether `hits.total` should be rendered as an integer or an object in the rest search response.

search#version.name: version
search#version.description: If `true`, returns document version as part of a hit.

search#_source.name: _source

search#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
search#_source_excludes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.
You can also use this parameter to exclude fields from the subset specified in `_source_includes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
search#_source_includes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.
If this parameter is specified, only these source fields are returned.
You can exclude fields from this subset using the `_source_excludes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search#seq_no_primary_term.name: seq_no_primary_term
search#seq_no_primary_term.description: If `true`, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit.

search#q.name: q
search#q.description:
Query in the Lucene query string syntax using query parameter search.
Query parameter searches do not support the full Elasticsearch Query DSL but are handy for testing.

search#size.name: size
search#size.description:
Defines the number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search#from.name: from
search#from.description:
Starting document offset.
Needs to be non-negative.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search#force_synthetic_source.name: force_synthetic_source
search#force_synthetic_source.description:
Should this request force synthetic _source?
Use this to test if the mapping supports synthetic _source and to get a sense of the worst case performance.
Fetches with this enabled will be slower the enabling synthetic source natively in the index.

search_application.get_behavioral_analyt.name: name
search_application.get_behavioral_analyt.description: A list of analytics collections to limit the returned information

search_application.search#name.name: name
search_application.search#name.description: The name of the search application to be searched.

search_application.search#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search_application.search#typed_keys.description: Determines whether aggregation names are prefixed by their respective types in the response.

search_mvt#index.name: index
search_mvt#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, or aliases to search

search_mvt#field.name: field
search_mvt#field.description: Field containing geospatial data to return

search_mvt#zoom.name: zoom
search_mvt#zoom.description: Zoom level for the vector tile to search

search_mvt#x.name: x
search_mvt#x.description: X coordinate for the vector tile to search

search_mvt#y.name: y
search_mvt#y.description: Y coordinate for the vector tile to search

search_mvt#exact_bounds.name: exact_bounds
search_mvt#exact_bounds.description:
If false, the meta layer’s feature is the bounding box of the tile.
If true, the meta layer’s feature is a bounding box resulting from a
geo_bounds aggregation. The aggregation runs on <field> values that intersect
the <zoom>/<x>/<y> tile with wrap_longitude set to false. The resulting
bounding box may be larger than the vector tile.

search_mvt#extent.name: extent
search_mvt#extent.description: Size, in pixels, of a side of the tile. Vector tiles are square with equal sides.

search_mvt#grid_agg.name: grid_agg
search_mvt#grid_agg.description: Aggregation used to create a grid for `field`.

search_mvt#grid_precision.name: grid_precision
search_mvt#grid_precision.description:
Additional zoom levels available through the aggs layer. For example, if <zoom> is 7
and grid_precision is 8, you can zoom in up to level 15. Accepts 0-8. If 0, results
don’t include the aggs layer.

search_mvt#grid_type.name: grid_type
search_mvt#grid_type.description:
Determines the geometry type for features in the aggs layer. In the aggs layer,
each feature represents a geotile_grid cell. If 'grid' each feature is a Polygon
of the cells bounding box. If 'point' each feature is a Point that is the centroid
of the cell.

search_mvt#size.name: size
search_mvt#size.description:
Maximum number of features to return in the hits layer. Accepts 0-10000.
If 0, results don’t include the hits layer.

search_mvt#with_labels.name: with_labels
search_mvt#with_labels.description:
If `true`, the hits and aggs layers will contain additional point features representing
suggested label positions for the original features.

search_shards#index.name: index
search_shards#index.description: Returns the indices and shards that a search request would be executed against.

search_shards#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search_shards#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search_shards#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search_shards#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

search_shards#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search_shards#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search_shards#local.name: local
search_shards#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

search_shards#preference.name: preference
search_shards#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

search_shards#routing.name: routing
search_shards#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search_template#index.name: index
search_template#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices,
and aliases to search. Supports wildcards (*).

search_template#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search_template#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

search_template#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search_template#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

search_template#explain.name: explain
search_template#explain.description: If `true`, the response includes additional details about score computation as part of a hit.

search_template#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search_template#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, specified concrete, expanded, or aliased indices are not included in the response when throttled.

search_template#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search_template#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search_template#preference.name: preference
search_template#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

search_template#profile.name: profile
search_template#profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

search_template#routing.name: routing
search_template#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search_template#scroll.name: scroll
search_template#scroll.description:
Specifies how long a consistent view of the index
should be maintained for scrolled search.

search_template#search_type.name: search_type
search_template#search_type.description: The type of the search operation.

search_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are rendered as an integer in the response.

search_template#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search_template#typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

searchable_snapshots.cache_stats#node_id.name: node_id
searchable_snapshots.cache_stats#node_id.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs or names to limit the returned information; use `_local` to return information from the node you're connecting to, leave empty to get information from all nodes

searchable_snapshots.clear_cache#index.name: index
searchable_snapshots.clear_cache#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names

searchable_snapshots.clear_cache#expand_.name: expand_wildcards
searchable_snapshots.clear_cache#expand_.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

searchable_snapshots.clear_cache#allow_n.name: allow_no_indices
searchable_snapshots.clear_cache#allow_n.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

searchable_snapshots.clear_cache#ignore_.name: ignore_unavailable
searchable_snapshots.clear_cache#ignore_.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

searchable_snapshots.stats#index.name: index
searchable_snapshots.stats#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names

searchable_snapshots.stats#level.name: level
searchable_snapshots.stats#level.description: Return stats aggregated at cluster, index or shard level

security.change_password#username.name: username
security.change_password#username.description:
The user whose password you want to change. If you do not specify this
parameter, the password is changed for the current user.

security.change_password#refresh.name: refresh
security.change_password#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.create_api_key#refresh.name: refresh
security.create_api_key#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.create_service_token#service.name: service
security.create_service_token#service.description: An identifier for the service name

security.create_service_token#name.name: name
security.create_service_token#name.description: An identifier for the token name

security.create_service_token#refresh.name: refresh
security.create_service_token#refresh.description: If `true` then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` (the default) then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.disable_user#username.name: username
security.disable_user#username.description: The username of the user to disable

security.disable_user#refresh.name: refresh
security.disable_user#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.disable_user_profile#uid.name: uid
security.disable_user_profile#uid.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

security.disable_user_profile#refresh.name: refresh
security.disable_user_profile#refresh.description:
If 'true', Elasticsearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation
visible to search, if 'wait_for' then wait for a refresh to make this operation
visible to search, if 'false' do nothing with refreshes.

security.enable_user#username.name: username
security.enable_user#username.description: The username of the user to enable

security.enable_user#refresh.name: refresh
security.enable_user#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.enable_user_profile#uid.name: uid
security.enable_user_profile#uid.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

security.enable_user_profile#refresh.name: refresh
security.enable_user_profile#refresh.description:
If 'true', Elasticsearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation
visible to search, if 'wait_for' then wait for a refresh to make this operation
visible to search, if 'false' do nothing with refreshes.

security.get_role#name.name: name
security.get_role#name.description: The name of the role. You can specify multiple roles as a comma-separated list. If you do not specify this parameter, the API returns information about all roles.

security.get_role_mapping#name.name: name
security.get_role_mapping#name.description: The distinct name that identifies the role mapping. The name is used solely as an identifier to facilitate interaction via the API; it does not affect the behavior of the mapping in any way. You can specify multiple mapping names as a comma-separated list. If you do not specify this parameter, the API returns information about all role mappings.

security.get_service_accounts#namespace.name: namespace
security.get_service_accounts#namespace.description: Name of the namespace. Omit this parameter to retrieve information about all service accounts. If you omit this parameter, you must also omit the `service` parameter.

security.get_service_accounts#service.name: service
security.get_service_accounts#service.description: Name of the service name. Omit this parameter to retrieve information about all service accounts that belong to the specified `namespace`.

security.get_user#username.name: username
security.get_user#username.description: An identifier for the user. You can specify multiple usernames as a comma-separated list. If you omit this parameter, the API retrieves information about all users.

security.get_user#with_profile_uid.name: with_profile_uid
security.get_user#with_profile_uid.description: If true will return the User Profile ID for a user, if any.

security.put_privileges#refresh.name: refresh
security.put_privileges#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.put_role#refresh.name: refresh
security.put_role#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.put_role_mapping#refresh.name: refresh
security.put_role_mapping#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.put_user#refresh.name: refresh
security.put_user#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.query_api_keys#with_limited_by.name: with_limited_by
security.query_api_keys#with_limited_by.description:
Return the snapshot of the owner user's role descriptors associated with the API key.
An API key's actual permission is the intersection of its assigned role descriptors and the owner user's role descriptors.

security.query_api_keys#with_profile_uid.name: with_profile_uid
security.query_api_keys#with_profile_uid.description: Determines whether to also retrieve the profile uid, for the API key owner principal, if it exists.

security.query_api_keys#typed_keys.name: typed_keys

security.update_user_profile_data#refres.name: refresh
security.update_user_profile_data#refres.description:
If 'true', Elasticsearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation
visible to search, if 'wait_for' then wait for a refresh to make this operation
visible to search, if 'false' do nothing with refreshes.

transform.get_transform#transform_id.name: transform_id
transform.get_transform#transform_id.description:
Identifier for the transform. It can be a transform identifier or a
wildcard expression. You can get information for all transforms by using
`_all`, by specifying `*` as the `<transform_id>`, or by omitting the
`<transform_id>`.

transform.get_transform#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
transform.get_transform#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no transforms that match.
2. Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If this parameter is false, the request returns a 404 status code when
there are no matches or only partial matches.

transform.get_transform#from.name: from
transform.get_transform#from.description: Skips the specified number of transforms.

transform.get_transform#size.name: size
transform.get_transform#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of transforms to obtain.

transform.get_transform#exclude_generate.name: exclude_generated
transform.get_transform#exclude_generate.description:
Excludes fields that were automatically added when creating the
transform. This allows the configuration to be in an acceptable format to
be retrieved and then added to another cluster.

transform.preview_transform#transform_id.name: transform_id
transform.preview_transform#transform_id.description:
Identifier for the transform to preview. If you specify this path parameter, you cannot provide transform
configuration details in the request body.

transform.preview_transform#timeout.name: timeout
transform.preview_transform#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the
timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

This could be a built-in analyzer, or an analyzer that’s been configured in the index.

attributes.description: Array of token attributes used to filter the output of the `explain` parameter.

settings.description: Configuration options for the target index.

is_write_index.description:
If `true`, sets the write index or data stream for the alias.
If an alias points to multiple indices or data streams and `is_write_index` isn’t set, the alias rejects write requests.
If an index alias points to one index and `is_write_index` isn’t set, the index automatically acts as the write index.
Data stream aliases don’t automatically set a write data stream, even if the alias points to one data stream.

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified, meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

priority.description:
Priority to determine index template precedence when a new data stream or index is created.
The index template with the highest priority is chosen.
If no priority is specified the template is treated as though it is of priority 0 (lowest priority).
This number is not automatically generated by Elasticsearch.

allow_auto_create.description:
This setting overrides the value of the `action.auto_create_index` cluster setting.
If set to `true` in a template, then indices can be automatically created using that template even if auto-creation of indices is disabled via `actions.auto_create_index`.
If set to `false`, then indices or data streams matching the template must always be explicitly created, and may never be automatically created.

ignore_missing_component_templates.description:
The configuration option ignore_missing_component_templates can be used when an index template
references a component template that might not exist

deprecated.description:
Marks this index template as deprecated. When creating or updating a non-deprecated index template
that uses deprecated components, Elasticsearch will emit a deprecation warning.

date_detection.description: Controls whether dynamic date detection is enabled.

dynamic_date_formats.description:
If date detection is enabled then new string fields are checked
against 'dynamic_date_formats' and if the value matches then
a new date field is added instead of string.

dynamic_templates.description: Specify dynamic templates for the mapping.

numeric_detection.description: Automatically map strings into numeric data types for all fields.

properties.description:
Mapping for a field. For new fields, this mapping can include:

- Field name
- Field data type
- Mapping parameters

index_patterns.description:
Array of wildcard expressions used to match the names
of indices during creation.

order.description:
Order in which Elasticsearch applies this template if index
matches multiple templates.

Templates with lower 'order' values are merged first. Templates with higher
'order' values are merged later, overriding templates with lower values.

aliases.description:
Aliases for the target index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

Configuration options for the index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

licenses.description: A sequence of one or more JSON documents containing the license information.

requests_per_second.description:
The desired requests per second for the deletion processes. The default

model_memory_limit.description:
The approximate maximum amount of memory resources that are permitted for
analytical processing. If your `elasticsearch.yml` file contains an
`xpack.ml.max_model_memory_limit` setting, an error occurs when you try to
create data frame analytics jobs that have `model_memory_limit` values
greater than that setting.

max_num_threads.description:
The maximum number of threads to be used by the analysis. Using more
threads may decrease the time necessary to complete the analysis at the
cost of using more CPU. Note that the process may use additional threads
for operational functionality other than the analysis itself.

allow_lazy_start.description:
Specifies whether this job can start when there is insufficient machine
learning node capacity for it to be immediately assigned to a node.

terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early.
Elasticsearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Elasticsearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Elasticsearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
Defaults to no timeout.

version.description: If true, returns document version as part of a hit.
